Reviews.Title: “Kind to would-be returning guests”
Reviews.Author: Tellurian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had planned to return to the Grand Hyatt DFW for an overnight stopover between Belize and Boston. Unfortunately, our Belize to Dallas flight was cancelled due to tornadoes in Dallas. By the time I was able to communicate with the Hyatt, it was technically too late to cancel my reservation without penalty, but under the circumstances, I was "forgiven." The personal understanding is most appreciated. Our replacement flights the next day did not route us through Dallas, but when future travel plans do, you can be sure our top choice hotel will be the Grand Hyatt DFW.

Reviews.Title: “Thin Walls makes Interesting Evening............”
Reviews.Author: dealdog
Reviews.Content: I have always been concerned about staying at hotels on the airport property. No matter how good the windows you will always have some noise. My experience at the Grand Hyatt DFW in April 2012 proved that while they did a good job with the windows the wall thickness or the air ducts between the rooms gave new meaning to the term "private". I was awaken at 2:30am by loud voices in the room next door.., ok....roll over.... go back to sleep....ten minutes later .....same story.... ten minutes later .... same story.... get out of bed.....bang on wall.....response was to FO...... called security .... met them in the hall....they took care of it and they were promptly told to FO by the guest....I heard all with my door closed and through the wall or air ducts or whatever. The young mans was obviously drunk and his voice was loud and the one I heard. I barely heard the security people or the women that he was with. The hotel staff was great and the hotel in general is world class but if it ain't one thing it is another...........traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Way to Spend the Night Before an Early Flight”
Reviews.Author: brooksz
Reviews.Content: I spent the night before a 7AM flight and woke up the next moring refreshed ready for the flight. The room was very comfortable, quiet and relaxing. (I had room 205 which is at the end of the hall and facing away from the runway.). The bathroom is large with a separate tub and glass enclosed shower. It does need to have better, brighter lighting with a more convenient mirror for make-up application. The bed is comfortable and there is an assortment of pillows. The TV is flatscreen and there is a good selection of tv channels. WIFI is pricey at $13.95 per day but if you have 3G or 4G it isnt an issue. Last, the sushi bar is pretty good. There is a another dining spot but I didnt try it. A tip is that you can acccess the spots inside the security gates ny showing your hotel key and a pass from the front desk. Last, there is. Spa on the top floor however you need an advance reservation as the staff is not always in. Give it a try and make your life and flight easier.

Reviews.Title: “Best airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: bergcarrie
Reviews.Content: Totally convenient as its connected to Terminal D. NOTE: if you come in at a different terminal, you will not see signs to direct you to the hotel. Take the skytram to Terminal D. Don't listen to the information desk, because they will send you to a shuttle that will take you to the other Hyatt close by. This happened to me, and it was 45 minutes of my life I will never get back. Beautiful hotel, recently remodeled. You have to pay for internet, unless you have been sucked in by Tmobile. Room was awesome. Push button lights and window screen, relatively quiet but do not get a room close to the elevator (ding, ding, ding all night). Bathrooms are roomy. Workout facility is rockstar. I was here for a meeting, and the food was amazing. Gluten free cookies to die for. They have these shrimp avocado things served in shot glasses, and I literally could have downed 10 of them. The only reason I didn't was because all my other co-workers were beating each other up to get one. Service was really great. They helped us find our boxes, gave us whatever we needed, and were very prompt. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a meeting. Concierge was fantastic. Printed my boarding pass, and they provide you with a ticket to get you through priority security, a bonus if you do not get to enjoy this feature regularly. The best airport hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Back again”
Reviews.Author: 3B
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel so that after a 10 hour flight we could just get off the plane and check in without facing a long drive. Check in : A pleasure walked straight to the desk and had our keys and upgraded runway view room within 5 mins. Bar: Decided to go for a walk then back to the bar for a drink and a snack as we were not really hungry kenough for a meal but needed something to take the edge off due to the time differences. Service: Fabulous! our drinks were ordered and returned quite promptly, although we did have to get the beer replaced due to some odd bits floating in the glass. My husband and daughter also ordered the Angus Burgers with fries which I tried as well and all 3 of agree it was probably one of the tastiest burgers we have had in a long while. Breakfast: This was included in our rate and I was unable to finish mine, smoked salmon/cream cheese/capers bagel, freshly squeezed OJ, and coffee. Daughter had the ham & cheese panini, and hubby had a full breakfast. Once again it was lovely and the service was really good. Room: Lovely and comfy with a view over the runway, large bathroom with shower and bath, in room safe big enough for a full size laptop, fridge, iron, ironing board, yoga mat, bath robe and amenities. Roof top pool: Small but big enough to cool off in and pretty neat to be able to see the runway and terminals from there. Gym: Looked quite good but not for me, quite a few pieces of equipment. Checkout: Very swift Overall: We enjoyed our 2nd time here, just a shame there is no space for the night before our return journey so that we could take the opportunity to eat a proper meal in the restaurant as last time the food was outstanding. Service we experienced on both visits has been outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room- but serious shortcomings.”
Reviews.Author: Trixiekiddo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has highs and lows. Absolutely beautifully designed rooms. The bathroom and entrance were dramatically dark and stylish- and there's something luxurious about an oversized bathroom. With a rainshower and cool light controls, the bathroom is the star of the room. Small touches like a hand mirror and robe were appreciated. BUT. $9.95 for wi-fi? Calling 3x just to get a coffee maker in the room? $14 for a movie rental? $10 for a can of beer? Fuzzy cable TV? A pretty room only goes so far- without functionality, what's the use. Unlike others, I didn't come here because it was at the airport- I came because it had a salt water pool. (Turned out to be too chilly, and no hot tub was to be had.) It was even more tiring to get to our room because of all the hassle of getting through the airport. We won't choose this hotel again. And that's probably all I needed to say anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start your holiday!...”
Reviews.Author: sammysyrett
Reviews.Content: After a 10 hour flight my family (me, mum and dad) stayed at the Grand Hyatt DFW over night. CHECK IN- Excellent and very friendly with no troubles at all. The check in staff were lovely! ROOM- Twin room over looking the run way, excellent view! if your into your planes then definately get a room with a view of the runway! Beds were large, confortable and very clean, we had an in room office type desk with lamp. Also in the room was a safe, water ($7!) ... can get cheaper in the airport shop "hudson times/ News" where you have snacks and cheaper priced drinks, there are also vending and ice machines on the room floors. There was a flat screen tv, ironing board, safe, mini bar, the usual. The bathroom was large with bath and seperate shower, with plenty of towels and lights. The aircon workes well and you had great shades on the main window. RESTURANT- very relaxed and friendly atmosphere, the staff were excellent and couldnt be faulted! the food portions were a good size and you must have the angus burger - best burger i have EVER had! RESTURANT - BREAKFAST - great choice of foods, i had a ham, egg and cheese panini - perfect for me! you also had pancakes, salmon, egg, bacon, etc etc... lots of choice and again, service was excellent! GYM - Well equipt and over looking the run way, POOL- on the roof top over looking the runway with a nice pool to cool off in and plenty of seating areas to just take in the atmosphere. Overall, this hotel is excellent and could not be faulted, friendly genuine caring staff, rooms finished to a high standard, would reccamend to all! .....

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but overwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: interviewqueen
Reviews.Content: I had the unfortunate opportunity to stay at the grand hyatt dfw not by choice but by American Airlines cancellation. When the flight was cancelled, we had to stay one more night in Dallas. We chose to stay at the airport grounds due to convenience. The hotel is located in terminal D and is easily accessible by airport tram. It turns out we weren't the only people staying due to cancellation. The check in staff reported she was out of king size beds but when we told her we had gold status, she quickly found a room with a king bed. Ironic, isn't it? we were hungry and tried out the restaurant and were told there would be an hour wait. It was Easter Sunday and American must have cancelled half of it's flights. The restaurant was poorly understaffed. We sat at the bar and due to our exhaustion, we ordered to go. The bartender was very busy and impatient. I realized why...she was the only person tending to all the customers at the bar, the snack area and the orders that the wait staff was putting in for drinks for the restaurant. Yes, she was the ONLY person. She ran around, flying from one end of the bar to the other, and back again and slamming glasses and wine bottles around. Soon we noticed she was so backed up, the wait staff started pouring their own wine. And not to mention the piles of dirty wine glasses, carafes, plates, sitting on top of the counter. We sat for an hour waiting for our food to go. We were lucky. Apparently people sitting down dining had a 2 hour wait. Maybe it was just a bad day/night. We ran into another couple on the elevator who bought food from the snack bar. They couldn't even get a plastic spoon. That's how bad it was. We proceeded to our room. It was right across the elevators. So you can hear everything. The room was very modernized, with a huge window that spanned the entire wall. Everything is electronic, and with a touch of a button, you can control the blinds, the lights , etc. The shower was quite small, the size of one I would expect in city living, such as DC. THere was a tub, opposite of stand up shower, that we didn't use. The bed was firm, too firm. When we woke up at 5 am the next morning, i hit the button "soft light", but it wasn't soft, it turned on all the lights and blinded me, instead. The worse part was hearing people talking and walking throughout the night. The rooms were fine, just request away from elevator. We would do it for convenience for traveling, but otherwise I would highly recommend the new omni convention center hotel if staying in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: GypsyJerseyGal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt DFW recently 1 night for a business trip. You can't beat the location of the property to the airport, that much is true. Shuttle service is included, which is a bonus. Rooms are nicely appointed, and quiet. We took the room rate which included breakfast, which was very good. Staff is very nice, no complaints there. Only complaint is that a stay here can be tough on the wallet, as the room price is high unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “A gem at DFW”
Reviews.Author: notoftheworld
Reviews.Content: Whenever traveling to Dallas/Ft. Worth on business, I always try and stay at the Grand Hyatt DFW or the Westin DFW. The Grand Hyatt DFW is a fine hotel with an excellent restaurant/ bar along with a coffee/snack bar with food provided by the same restaurant. It means the fruit bowls contain fresh, ripe fruit and the baked goods are top quality The breakfasts are excellent and can often be included with promo rates the hotel frequently offers. There is a full service Spa. The gym has plenty of cardio and weight machines and along with the outdoor pool are open 24hrs. One downside is room service is not 24hrs. There is free parking and valet (fee) available. The rooms are very clean and while simple, they are roomy and include every amenity one would need. It's not as lavish as the Ritz Carlton or the Mandarin but still warrants a 5 star rating based on the service and location. You have to request a coffee maker but they offer complimentary "illy" coffee downstairs in the AM. Bathrooms include a separate tub & shower. Lots of granite. Also included is a yoga mat, bathrobe, iron & ironing board. All aspects of the service provided is exemplary and they deserve to be commended. To have such a nice hotel right in the airport is a real "gem". Sometimes the rates can be quite high, but always search for the various deals offered around. The Hyatt site is where you should look first. If you're an aviation buff, ask for a room on a high floor runway side.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....WAY OVER PRICED”
Reviews.Author: ThunderDan1138
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt DFW is a great hotel. Its put together really well and in a great location, but the price is outragous. I can not see someone paying such a high fee for a simple room. Luckily I was able to secure a very reasonable rate on another website but there is no way this hotel is worth the full price. The person affording this hotel obviously has money to waste. The in room bar prices are crazy high, the main reason i didnt eat or drink any of it. I respect this hotel for its location, Terminal D at DFW, which allowed us to stay close to airport for our early morning departure. I would stay there again but only if I am able to obtain a cheaper price like I did this trip. They do validate your parking pass for each night you stay at the hotel which can save you some good money for parking. The security for the hotel helped us secure a fridge for our baby food and that same person helped us with luggage to our room. I gave him a great tip when he dropped off the fridge, that I had to call for two times, but when he took the tip he just walked away without acknowledging that I was giving him the tip. YOUR WELCOME!! The front desk attendant was fantastic but didnt offer me the validation for parking only since i asked her for one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: alisonk78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a night after a long flight from Australia via Los Angeles. We booked the room through Expedia and got a great deal. The hotel room was one of the nicest I've ever stayed in, and it and the bathroom were both enormous. Our king bed was lovely and comfortable, so much so that we ended up sleeping for 11 hours! Room service was prompt and tasty - we had a pizza and a cheeseburger. We also had a late breakfast downstairs the following morning, and it was reasonably priced and delicious. All of the staff from check in, room service and the restaurant were helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, not just because of its convenient location to the airport but because it's an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel when flying out of DFW early”
Reviews.Author: Tom N
Reviews.Content: In searching for a hotel by the airport, I was surprised to find the Grand Hyatt right inside one of the terminals at DFW. This was great for us since we had a 6:30am flight with two small kids. Little did we know how great this hotel was for kids. We arrived with a rental car and the valet let us park at his stand while we checked in and I could come back to return the car at a different part of the airport. The desk staff noted we had kids and placed us in a room facing the runway (think front row seats) so they could watch the planes take off and land. I was worried a bit about noise but the rooms are built with some seriously thick glass and we heard no outside noise at all. So off to the rooftop pool where we watched more planes come and go while splashing around in the pool. How fun was that? Dinner was no problem as we opted to order pizza delivered to our room. There were also folks bringing up food from the airport restaurants. When we return to Dallas, I definitely plan on booking a night at this hotel. Great service, clean/well designed space and fun for the kids. Even the maids smile at you and ask you how your stay is going. Top down they have figured out how to run a hotel properly.

Reviews.Title: “Best airport hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: TooOldtosurf
Reviews.Content: It's a bummer when your flight is canceled and you can't go home but at least when this happens in Dallas you have a nice hotel to drown your sorrows for the night. Our flight was canceled and at the last minute, late at night we stumbled into the Grand Hyatt for a room. We were quickly accomodated and in our room in less than 15 minutes. The next morning when it was time to catch our flight we were a quick 5 minute walk to the terminal and on our way. It is hard to beat this hotel for convenience. When you get through the initial giddiness of being so close to the departure gate and past the Grand Hyatt branding you realize the rooms are well furnished and you can't hear any airport or highway noise. For being a hotel with a high turnover rate the rooms were also very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: morjem911
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an early flight the next morning. The check in was super easy. We had a park and fly package and since our vacation was one day longer than the package deal covered the parking, they actually gave us a voucher for that extra day! The room was beautiful and quiet. We didn't use the pool, but went up and looked at it and it was beautiful too. The bed was really comfortable, and I wish I could have slept in it longer! The nice thing was, we went ahead and checked in for our flight that night (couldn't check our bags though), so we were able to use our boarding passes at security and go eat in the terminal that night. Make sure you pay attention to the signs in the parking garage. We parked in what we thought was the hotel parking, but when I went back out to the car later that night, I noticed I was in 2 hour parking instead and the hotel parking was a little further back in the garage, so I moved. That was totally my fault, but would have been horrible to come back and find our car had been towed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: krawimi
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt DFW sets the bar for other Hyatts. The people were professional and friendly. The rooms were stylish, fairly large, comfortable and surprisingly quiet. It is a Hyatt, but definitely on the highest end of Hyatts I have seen. My room was on the 3rd floor and I expected to hear some airport noise, but it was silent. I didn't hear hallway noise or noise from other rooms either (and the hotel was full). In terms of location, it's in the airport (so that's either a plus or a minus depending on your needs). But this is definitely no ordinary airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Updated rooms. Convenient airport location.”
Reviews.Author: RobfromPA
Reviews.Content: Had a recent brief stay. Rooms are spacious and recently updated. Food wasn't that great from room service. Recommend getting something from a terminal restaurant. Quiet even though at airport.

Reviews.Title: “Day rate”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda B
Reviews.Content: I didn't need an room overnight -- just a few hours to shower, repack, etc. prior to a long non-stop flight back to Australia. There was nothing I could find on their website about a day rate/hourly rate, so I called them and found they did do a day rate. And when I got there, reception also offered me another option -- $30 for the use of the fitness centre for a shower and space to repack. I still chose the room, even though it was only for 3 hours. What a room! High-tech auto/touch everything (lights, a/c, etc.), HUGE black bathroom with separate shower (wonderful spray and pressure), big room. Can't comment on the beds as I didn't sleep in them. Day rate worth it just for the downtime and reinvigorating shower after a long drive (I drove in from Little Rock) and prior to a long international flight. WiFi not free ($9.95 for 24 hours), so I thethered my phone instead. Loved the proximity to Terminal D (right inside it!), and would choose this hotel again if I was flying into/out of DFW. I stayed at the Hyatt Regency DFW coming in, but you have to get a shuttle etc. The Grand Hyatt is MUCH more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: Moonstonemoclips
Reviews.Content: As with most - staying overnight. Arrived terminal C and took the skylink to D. Takes 15 mins. If you have time, the better value is to stay off airport. I had barely 8 hours so paid the extra to stay on airport. Breakfast was very good, room of a 5 star standard - no complaints, touch screen to turn everything on/off besides the bed saved the usual running around trying to figure the lights. Yes - would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in DFW”
Reviews.Author: Mo2men
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night coming from Dubai. It is integrated in Terminal D so it is easy to access when arriving by international flight. The view is nice. No noise. Tasty food. I recommend this hotel for short accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Easily earns its #1 rating!”
Reviews.Author: Nannarpite
Reviews.Content: Got stranded in DFW for the night, but was so happy with the hotel that I didn't mind a single bit! Love that the hotel is attached to the terminal building, so there is no need to go outside once you're in the airport. One of the first things that struck me about the room was how nice it smelled: like freshly laundered clothes. It was so comforting! The room itself was lovely. The furnishings were new, tasteful and modern, and the bathroom was enormous. It had a huge tub and a separate shower. The room was a pretty big with a large TV and a window that covered the entire wall. We had been told that the view from this room wasn't good, but I disagree. It's quite hard to describe, but it was kind of like looking out on the Millennium dome in London, but actually FROM the dome. We were obviously looking out at the roof of the building below, but it seemed quite futuristic. Certainly not something I would want to look on everyday, but it was really quite interesting for an overnight, and the window comes with an automatic shade that blocks the whole thing out. Anyway, who cares about the view at an airport, right? The rate included breakfast which I highly recommend getting because they allow you to use this credit for room service and it was a lot of food. I had the mushroom and onion omelet and my husband had the egg white, both came with toast, and both were excellent. We also got a pot of coffee each (listed as 'small' on the menu, but I must have had 3 cups and didn't even finish it) and two large glasses of juice. I also really appreciated the thoughtful inclusion of a yoga mat in the closet which I would loved to have used if I had not been so pressed for time. Actually, I'd have liked to have stayed an extra night as this hotel was such a welcome change from any other airport hotel. In fact, I think it's safe to say that this hotel is better than most at which I've ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue for a corporate meeting!”
Reviews.Author: JulieSandpoint_Idaho
Reviews.Content: I'm a corporate event planner for a small company and we recently held our annual national sales meeting at this hotel. It's a very convenient location as you can fly into DFW and never have to leave airport property to get to the hotel. Every single member of the Grand Hyatt staff went out of their way to be helpful and ensured our two-day meeting went off without a hitch. The sleeping rooms were fantastic and they provided very nice welcome amenities for our VIPs. The meeting space was perfect and the food (both catered and restaurant) was very good, although expensive. This hotel was just renovated and they have done a fantastic job with it - all areas of the hotel are very beautiful and much nicer than one would expect at an airport hotel. I have planned events at many top hotels around the country and this is one of the best in terms of customer service. The only negative I had in my experience was a slight snafu in booking our group of 40 people into the restaurant but that was resolved and we had a lovely dinner. I would recommend this hotel to anyone conducting a business meeting or needing a nice place to lay over while in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic remodel”
Reviews.Author: JBPortland
Reviews.Content: A 3-day business meeting at the DFW Grand Hyatt has been an annual event for several years. This year the "ho hum" hallways and rooms had been redone in a tasteful modern decor. My complements to the decorator. Unless you like to watch airplanes land and take off or to view parking structures and airport roof tops during the day, the best views are at night from the pool deck or upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: is0lde
Reviews.Content: Its new, clean and comfy. Located in the American Airline International Terminal. There are 3 restaurants to choose from in the Hotel, offering 3 dinning levels, Lounge Grill, Sushi Bar, and Fine Dining. There is also a Spa. Our room was very well appointed, no complaints. Excellent Staff. All that was missing was Free Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at the Grand Hyatt DFW”
Reviews.Author: mom2amywill
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Grand Hyatt DFW to attend a meeting. It was convenient to reach in Terminal D via Skylink even after landing in Terminal A. Check-in was quick with efficient staff and lunch was enjoyable in the Grand Met restaurant. The meeting space was inviting with lovely art and pictures all along the foyer. Surprisingly, the buffet dinner with our meeting was some of the best food I have had in awhile--definitely not the usual hotel rubber chicken! The rooms had a number of amenities, were clean, very quiet, and had comfortable beds. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. One of the best hotel experiences I have had in a while.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for when you have an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: bkesler84
Reviews.Content: We used the check-in kiosk upon arrival which was very easy to use and nice to have when their are long lines at the check-in counter. It dispenses your room keys without ever having to speak to an agent. We also used it upon checkout and it was still easy to use and there is a drop box to drop your room keys into. The rooms at the Grand Hyatt DFW have been remodeled and the new electronic features (electronic shades & lights) are a nice touch. You can open/close the shades & turn on/off lights directly from a control panel on your night stand. It didn't appear that the bathrooms had been remodeled, however they are very spacious and it is nice to have a separate tub & shower. A nice perk of staying at the Grand Hyatt DFW is you can access the secure side of the DFW terminals directly from Terminal D. You have to let the front counter staff know that you want to take advantage of this and they will contact a DPS official to check your IDs. As long as everything checks out, they give you an entry pass to be able to get through the security checkpoint. You are required to go through an enhanced screening process, but it really was no big deal. Then you are able to take advantage of the restaurants within any terminal (since you can ride the SkyLink) or browse through the shops. Make sure you get there early though, because they can only issue the entry passes through 8pm, but you can stay in the terminal until it closes. We also used their Park Sleep Fly rate which includes 7 days of parking within your room rate. However, we discovered upon check-in (we did have to ask an agent) that you can get up to 4 additional days included at no additional cost to you.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERIOR AIRPORT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: marenostrum
Reviews.Content: For all those fellow travelers who are tired of airports and the eternal stresses that have developed around simply taking a plane ride, you will find tremendous solace in a small island of tranquility at the Grand Hyatt DFW Airport. On a recent trip to Ixtapa/Zihuatanejo, Mexico, we were traveling through DFW from Washington DC. Due to forecasted snow on our day of departure, American Airlines cancelled our outbound flight and they re-booked us so that we over-nighted, at our expense though, in Dallas in order to catch the one-day-a-week flight to Ixtapa. You should note that there are two Hyatt hotels at DFW. In terminal C is the Hyatt Regency DFW and in terminal D is the Grand Hyatt. We decided to choose the Grand Hyatt given that our plane was due to leave from this very same terminal. To our surprise, the Grand Hyatt is a stunning hotel even superior to any city hotel in which we have stayed let along the reputation of â€œairportâ€� hotels. In the event that you arrive at any other terminal, there are regular (free) airport shuttles that will take you to the Grand Hyatt in terminal D. For starters, once one collects their bags in terminal D, it is a very easy walk and an escalator ride to the elevators to the Hyatt. What struck me as we approached the hotel elevators was that the American Airlines check-in (for our following day departure) could not have been more than 50 steps away with the security area literally adjacent to it. Nothing like rolling out of bed and checking-in for your flight! Exiting the hotel elevator, you will be presented with a well appointed lobby to your left and to your right a very attractive bar and restaurant. This hotel also offers conference facilities that are rather impressive. Our west facing room was a suite on the sixth floor that was spacious with a living room and very large bedroom. The dÃ©cor is modern and minimalist with a very fancy lighting and (electric) blind/curtain system. The standard amenities are all included. Yet, a peculiarity was noted that we never experienced: you have to call the reception so that they can deliver a coffee maker/pot for the room. This is very odd. Although the rooms are well insulated and may be stating the obvious, you will hear some noise of the departing aircrafts even if they may not be using the runways in front of terminal D. Yet, traffic subsides significantly after 10pm. A quick tour of the property is worth it not just to familiarize oneself, but to appreciate the many amenities. Aside from the expansive conference facilities and business center, it has a very good fitness center, outdoor pool and sun deck. Features that I am sure would come in handy when staying during warmer months. The restaurant is very large and attractive. We have a very tasty breakfast the following morning. This hotel was a great stress reliever due to our initial tempestuous departure and it reset the tone for our one week vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: tomlucky85
Reviews.Content: this is the first time we are in USA to travel.and we are so happy to stay here I like this hotel very much because of The rooms are very big and have electronic controls for evrything including window shades.they have a good bar where you can choose any kind of drink,my wife loves the shower with bathtub,very clean room and good service.we will recommended to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay in DFW”
Reviews.Author: brizzeyAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights before my flight back to Australia and it couldnt be better. I am currently still at the hotel and amd enjoying the stay immensely. Check in was very fast and friendly and the bars and restaurants are excellent with fantastic service . The rooms are very big and have electronic controls for evrything including window shades. Very comfortable bed and big bathroom with sep shower and bathtub. couldnt ask for more and right in the termial D , outside security so no probs there. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve480977
Reviews.Content: From check in to leaving, top service amazing hotel. One of best my family and I have stayed in. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient location, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: BillF
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right at the airport. Arrived in Terminal D, so it was a short walk. Check-in was quick, room was clean and well appointed. If you are looking for a convenient hotel to DFW, this would be a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ItsAboutTheTravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property several times and always have a excellent experience. The rooms are big clean and comfortable. The food is fantastic room service, banquets and the restaurant! The staff is top notch a real pleasure to deal with!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: jojo2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed there twice in January. Travelling on points with AA from Montreal to Puerto-Vallarta, you had to be flexible. So we had an overnight on our way there and also coming back. You can't beat the location, right inside terminal D. For both stays our room was the same. The bed is confortable, the bathroom is great. Separate shower and bathtub. The amenities are also great. My best features are the blind and the shades that rolls up automaticaly when you enter the room. Also the "pad" by the bedsides that control all the lights, the room temperature and the blinds, all by the touch of a sensor!!! AMAZING !!

Reviews.Title: “very good 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Derek_H
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed here for 1 night after a 15 hr flight from australia. hotel is right upstairs from Qantas arrivals in terminal D. room was very comfortable & roomy. We were lucky and had a nice view of the airport runway. No noise problems at all. would definately stay here again ..

Reviews.Title: “Not your average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greywacke
Reviews.Content: We held a professional meeting at this site. It was extremely convenient as a site--right at the airport. Unlike most airport hotels, this one is lovely, modern, and spotless. The soundproofing is excellent; I heard no plan noise during my stay. The rooms are gorgeous, with floor-to-ceiling windows and electronic controls of everything by the bedside. Power outlets inside the nightstands are very convenient. Beds are comfortable, and the staff genuinely care about your stay and will go out of their way to make it the best possible. I highly recommend it and would happily use the site again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Right at the Airport”
Reviews.Author: SarasotaTrav
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel at least 25 times over the past ten years. Always a safe bet. Connected to concourse D. Great rooms, nice bar area with TVs, good menu. Very convenient if you are laying over or very central if you are seeing both Dallas and Ft Worth. Also, very limited airport noise for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for a stuck traveler at DFW”
Reviews.Author: donnakmc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt DFW on a Saturday night when we missed our flight connection due to weather delay. The hotel lobby is literally right in the terminal, and was just a few steps and an escalator ride up from the customs hall where we picked up our luggage. The airline (American) got us a steep discount - comparable to a budget motel. The rooms are very modern, clean, with top notch decor. A big walk in shower was a nice thing after a long travel day. We ate dinner late in their restaurant / lounge, and though the price was high, the food was excellent. The only included morning offering was a cup of coffee down in their lobby area, where they seemed a bit offended that we didn't want to buy anything else. Clearly this place is intended for business travelers on expense accounts during the week, with maximum room rates posted on the door of over $800 / night. LOL We slept well in a comfortable bed and continued our trip by walking out into the terminal the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great and expensive”
Reviews.Author: Eugene1984
Reviews.Content: Sheets were to small for bed, came off at your feet in the night. Shower had a hatch above it that was partially off so you could see into crawl space. Toilet seat wasn't clean. nice bar/ lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “Most convenient Hotel in DFW Airport”
Reviews.Author: jnpaussies2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a layover of around 10hours in Dallas, wanting some rest before the flight from DFW to SYD. Turned out a great idea and very pleasant stay. Location: DFW Terminal D (free shuttle available from A,B,C terminals). GR8 for Aussies/anyone returning home on Qantas (departing from D Terminal) as the Hotel is right above Terminal D. Room: Deluxe King - Very impressive, modern with everything you could wish for including black out shades. Bath/sep shower and good internet access (at cost - no free wi-fi here - one of USA's only hotels without free wi-fi !).Comfortable bed. Some very minor plane noise, but overall very comfortable, spacious and very clean. No complaints. Facilities: 9 floors and good restaurant/dining/ in room dining options. The gym and outdoor pool on rooftop well appointed. Recommend book a spa treatment in advance if you want a massage in between /prior to your flight. Direct (elevator & escalator) access to terminal D. Overall: GR8 location for pre/post sstopovers in DFW. Very modern, clean and comfortable. Front Desk staff were a bit officious and not overly friendly or helpful, even for a Passport member (loyalty was ignored initially) but for a short stay - fine. Would definately return if travel required. Most convenient Hotel in DFW Airport area.

Reviews.Title: “Stopover”
Reviews.Author: edmag_12
Reviews.Content: Stayed over on way to Tortola British virgin Islands and on return to Australia. Fantastic hotel with everything you would wish for in a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Layover in Dallas? This is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingProf52
Reviews.Content: Recently we had a flight issue that left us stranded at DFW. Fortunately the airline put us up at the Grand Hyatt. What could have been a totally frustrating experience was turned into a very pleasant evening. The service at the desk and the restaurant was superb and the room was beyond comfortable and luxurious. Please, can't we be stranded at DFW again?

Reviews.Title: “High quality airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roadwarrior1000
Reviews.Content: Most airport hotels are average in terms of standard. The Grand Hyatt is not. It has very high quality rooms with superb views of the airport, staff who clearly have been well selected and trained, and a restaurant which may have a rather limited menu, but very high standards of cuisine. Located in Termial D at DFW Airport, this is definitely the place to stay after a long flight, otherwise you end up with transfers to hotels which are probably atleast 30 minutes drive from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Management turnover, but no break in service”
Reviews.Author: scarab_9
Reviews.Content: This is a top award winner within the Hyatt brand, largely due to the manager, Andrew Davidson. He has moved up to manage the Park Hyatt Washington DC; look for that property to improve. The current manager, Lance Martin, is still settling in. There are minor lapses, but overall the hotel has maintained its excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at DFW.”
Reviews.Author: MooneyPilot
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay at GHDFW. Room was quite nice, modern, cool touch controls. Bathroom was nice as well. Hotel has a sushi bar in the lobby (nice touch). and really is a great place for a business meeting or quick overnight at DFW...

Reviews.Title: “Can't think of a better Hyatt hotel”
Reviews.Author: econometricsquant
Reviews.Content: I'm sure there are better Hyatt PROPERTIES out there, but this location - as a hotel itself - is absolutely tops. I'm a Hyatt Gold Passport Platinum member, and I have stayed at many a-Hyatt's... this now ranks at the top. The rooms are incredibly modern with touch-button controls for all the lighting, heating and A/C, and shades on the windows. It's very nice to be able to control everything from right next to your bed. We were on the highest floor, and the views of the runway / tarmac at DFW are great. There's plenty to sit and watch from that perch. The in-room dining was very good and pretty reasonable. My wife and I split a grilled chicken salad, and a half chicken entree that was delicious. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful as well. Overall, a very, very nice short stay!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: emmaboda
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. Staff were attentive and friendly and the hotel itself was stylish and comfortable. I had to stay here one night because I missed my connecting flight. Was so happy to have such a lovely place to stay over.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacularly modern.”
Reviews.Author: efembe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grand Hyatt as flying back to UK from Terminal D. Check-in very efficient, and the room was amazing, not a switch anywhere, everything controlled by touch controls...room itself was very large with perfect viewing over the runway. Lots of gadgets to play with and a very comfortable bed. Bathroom was vast with a splendid walk-in shower. I did have one major problem with in-room dining breakfast, but this was efficiently and speedily dealt with by both Manager and Head Chef. I would recommend hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandeep420
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here. I had originally booked Hyatt Regency (also at DFW) but my late night flight arrived at Terminal D and the next morning flight was also leaving from Terminal D so I decided to stay at Grant Hyatt instead. The front desk staff was very friendly and efficient. My check-in took total of one minute including canceling my original reservation. The restaurant staff was also awesome - took out dinner and had breakfast there. The coffee was fantastic. The room was elegant and classy with view of the planes taking off. Would highly recommend Grand Hyatt to anyone planning to spend a night at DFW.

Reviews.Title: “It was as expected!”
Reviews.Author: 217mami14
Reviews.Content: Looking forward to my trip to Dallas (for the first time to see my Cowboys at Home in the new stadium), I was pleasantly uplifted with my stay at the Grand Hyatt at DFW (Dallas-Fort Worth Airport). Working backwards, I left the hotel for the stadium, with a great breakfast to "kickoff" the day, from the restaurant. I cannot remember the dish, but it was oh so good! Like any hotel with such elegance, things may be on the pricey side, but well worth it. (You are on vacation after all, so splurge!). The room was extremely nice...you can tell they've recently had some renovations done with their state of the art controls. The view of the planes and runways from the comfort of the room was an added bonus. I had in mind to head out to The Glass Cactus Friday night, but the food, drink, and company at the restaurant/bar was keeping me in from the cold. I met some stranded travellers...some with interesting stories, and some with...well..."interesting stories". The staff was excellent - despite some health ailments that still kept one "emplyee-of-the-month" candidate working herself to close - and on Christmas weekend, no less! (Good health on the ankle!) All kidding aside, many thanks to Rosa for her hospitality, and Martha (received your card, with thanks...and yes, you were correct...it is a great hotel, and no regrets on the choice), and to Andrea for the amenities delivery - and card - to the room (totally unnecessary, but very much appreciated)! You're all classy, working at a classy hotel! And despite the game result not being in favour of the Cowboys, the stay - and stadium experience - made it worthwhile. (I was able to escape the parking situation with no problems at all, Andrea.) I'd truly recommend a stay here regardless of you being a traveller or not. Merry Christmas and Happy New Year, Folks! Hope to convince some friends to stay there next time we're back in town. America's Team will be calling (us) back again from Canada, I'm sure. Marco

Reviews.Title: “great airport hotel, especially if flying out of Terminal D!”
Reviews.Author: captainTexas
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that we live 1.5 hours away from Dallas and travel often departing from DFW. Our standard routine is to drive to DFW the night before we leave and take advantage of the "park and fly" rate at the Grand Hyatt. We have stayed at this hotel an exorbitant number of times. You cant beat this modern well run hotel with its perfect location inside Terminal D. Check-in is quick and easy and the staff is most accomodating. The rooms have recently been redone (not that they really needed to be) and remind me of a nice Vegas hotel (Wynn or Encore) with electric shades/curtains and most room features able to be controlled from bedside table. Nice comfortable beds and linens are sure to give you a pleasant nice sleep as well as the rooms appear to be pretty soundproof. We usually have dinner at the bar where they have a very nice drink and small plate menu including sushi, flatbread pizzas, and crabcakes. You can also order from main restaurant menu which is actually a great restaurant (enjoyed a great filet there one night). Bartenders provide excellent service and you really forget that you are inside a busy airport due to the ambience and service. If you find yourself needing to stay near or in DFW, this is your hotel. Trust me, I have stayed here at least a dozen times and dont have a single complaint about this well run Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Best Airport Hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: mindisp
Reviews.Content: I travel for work in the music business. I had to end a tour and fly everyone out on Christmas vacation. We pulled up to the hotel located right at at Terminal D. Very easy access to the airport (it right there!) and the staff was pleasant and organized! Highly recommend this hotel to any business travel or group if you are in or out of DFW. Simple, easy and smart!

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel which happens to be at the airport”
Reviews.Author: scl44
Reviews.Content: Having admired the sleek exterior on many trips through DFW Airport, I selected the Grand Hyatt for my weekend trip to Dallas. The stay started beautifully, as my American Airlines flight arrived in Terminal D. Minutes later I was in the lobby and enthusiastically greeted by the front desk staff. My slated room was not available, so the associate upgraded me to an executive suite with a runway view. As an airplane aficionado, the large windows afforded a perfect view of takeoffs and landings. And despite the proximity to the runway, the plane noises were surprisingly distant although still audible. The recently renovated guest rooms feature a modern look and amenities. There is a control panel to adjust the window shades and lighting and a comfortable chaise lounge next to the window (ideal for planespotting). The elegant bathroom includes a separate shower and bathtub. The executive suite included a living area with a desk, couch, and flat screen television. Outside the guest room, the Grand Met restaurant has mastered the art of table for one â€“ there is a row of seats with personal televisions. The food was above par for hotel fare, and the service was attentive. The fitness center is located on the top floor, and there is also a rooftop pool. For those venturing outside the airport, garage parking is included in the rate. In summary, the Grand Hyatt DFW is not just an airport hotel â€“ it is an exceptional hotel which happens to be at the airport. From the front desk associates to the housekeeping staff, the service was impeccable â€“ responsive, personable, and spirited. Pros: Ultra convenient to the terminal, modern and stylish guest rooms, fitness center and rooftop pool Cons: None â€“ a flawless experience, and I will select this hotel on my next trip to Dallas

Reviews.Title: “Great Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: Mike J
Reviews.Content: Great Hyatt and nice location. Not cheap to get anywhere from here if you want to leave for dinner though.

Reviews.Title: “My easiest hotel experience EVER!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: idocgu
Reviews.Content: Got off the plane in DFW in terminal D. Took about 100 yard walk to the security checkpoint. Walked out to my left up the escalator to the hotel. Put my credit card in the computer for check in, I was in my very well appointed room in about 5 minutes after I got off the plane. Went downstairs, ate incredible sushi, GREAT CHEF. Super quick service, back to the comfortable bedroom, very mild airplane noise, hardly realized I was in the airport. Next morning went to the same computer downstairs to check out. Down the escalator back thru security and on the plane. Could not have been easier, great, convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis”
Reviews.Author: Lucybelle1
Reviews.Content: I had a 7 hours layover in DFW and we were travelling with our 18 month son... After the 9 1/2 hours international flight, this was like a mirage. Since we arrived at 6 AM and our flight was leaving at 1 PM we were given a special rate. The rooms was ample and had very comfortable beds. Everything was sparkling. The bathroom one of the best I have seen in any hotel and had both a shower and a tub (which allowed us to give a relaxing bath to our baby). Loved the way you can open the shades! That allowed our kid to be entertained by watching the planes taking off (through the almost soundproof window). When it was time for checkout, the front desk gave us passes so we can go through security faster (using the First Class and Crew lines). I can't recommend this hotel enough. Whoever manages this place should be given a promotion!

Reviews.Title: “"Moka Cafe -- Good coffee, but service was a bit lacking"”
Reviews.Author: User_Default
Reviews.Content: I had a 2 1/2 hr. layover at DFW, so I arranged for a friend to meet me for coffee and a chat while waiting for my plane. The choices in DFW that were outside of security were all in the Grand Hyatt, and we chose Moka Lounge (partly because we could also watch the Football game on the big screen). The coffee was good, a basic brew coffee, but not those cheap burned-roast blends that so many hotels go with. We were served promptly, but when it came time to go -- I had set an alarm on my phone -- the waitress was nowhere to be seen. I found her by the cashier counter, and after a moment or so -- apparently I was interrupting something she was doing -- she rang up my check and invited me to charge it to my room. Ahh... I was just passing through... As the carry-on bag in my hand should have hinted... I had a twenty in my hand but she disappeared before I could hand it to her. Another server who had been nearby also disappeared. Fortunately, I had enough small bills to cover the tab and a small tip... If I had waited for her to return, I might still be there. Still, it's always a bit disconcerting to leave cash lying on a counter (even in the leather booklet), hoping that the waitress (and not a random stranger) will pick it up. But I did have time to clear security and get to my gate before my plane boarded, so all's well that ends well...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Hexthorpe
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel while in transit to St. Lucia. I highly recommend it. The room was excellent and the hotel couldn't be in a better location. We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant, it was very good but wasn't cheap. Unless it was a special occasion on another stay we would probably eat in the hotel bar which is next to the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “a fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: swtp232
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff that made a special fuss over us because we were on our way to our honeymoon. They upgraded us to an amazing sweet with a beautiful view. Super convenient location in terminal D. I highly recommend the package including parking as it means your car is right outside the terminal when you get back.

Reviews.Title: “What a Relief!”
Reviews.Author: 2Babyboomes
Reviews.Content: After 15 hours flying from Sydney, it was such a relief after collecting our bags to just take the elevator to the hotel. If arriving at Terminal D, then this is the best hotel option. Aside from the convenience, the rooms are stylish and comfortable (especially loved the bathroom), it's modern and very clean and the restaurant serves a good breakfast (don't know about other services). I didn't find the reservation staff all that welcoming, but the porter and restaurant staff were lovely. We enjoyed a couple of hours in 'historic Grapevine'. Worth a trip on the shuttle for those who have a little time to spare.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in the middle (of DFW Airport) with you”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaAnne
Reviews.Content: What I meant was, this is great if you wish to get in and out via the airport, and you do not wish to venture into either Ft. Worth or Dallas. There are no nice restaurants nearby, other than in the airport or this hotel. That is a definite minus. No Tex Mex here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rafaelstravels
Reviews.Content: One of the best airport hotels I've ever been to. Well maintained and great facilities. Five things for management to consider: 1) Would rather have a buffet breakfast 2) For the price, it'd be great to have some slippers 3) Annoying to have to log-in every time you use wifi 4) THe room doors should be better - a bit noisy 5) ensure the newspaper is delivered in the morning - 2 or the three nights I stayed, the paper wasn't delivered The front desk staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JudyVirginiaBeach
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on my way to Las Vegas. The staff were very friendly. Great restaurant too. It is where I'd stay if ever in Dallas again.

Reviews.Title: “If you have stay at the airport this is the place!”
Reviews.Author: BFLOMAN
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is simply one of the best airport hotels I have stayed at. It is super convienent if you are flying in and out of DFW as it is attached to the D Terminal. Rooms are large, modern, nicely decorated, and well sound proof to reduce the airport noise. One of the best wireless networks...super fast! Great restaurant and bar. Friendly staff makes this hotel a great place to stay. You won't go wrong if you find yourself here for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Great property and location!”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a stay at this property. This is a great hotel - the rooms were very clean, updated and well appointed. Great sushi at the bar as well.

Reviews.Title: “This "airport hotel" blew us away in a positive way”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: Not what we have all come to expect from an airport hotel which tend to be convinient but tired in many ways. The Grand Hyatt Dallas was a wonderful experience all the way around. The quality and finish of the rooms and public spaces are right up there with some of the better downtown facilities. We would highly recommend for a stay over or more. The staff was absolutely incredible they deserve "6 STARS". Room service food was great as was the quality in the lobby restaurant. Loved it and a pleasant surprise - well done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peterjules
Reviews.Content: I arrived from Australia to stay for one night to meet my husband to allow us to travel on and found that my booking was not showing completely in their system. I did not look forward to having hiccups but the staff there made booking in so simple. They were more than helpful especially in providing advice after I found my mobile phone was not working. The room was fantastic and very comfortable. I expected to find something very minimalistic being by the airport, but I was very pleasantly surprised. The bathroom was very spacious, clean and modern. I dined at the bar downstairs which was welcoming and very busy (obviously very popular) and the meal was very reasonably priced. Breakfast was excellent as well, especially the attention provided by the staff. I found the hotel very easy to access from the airport (didn't have to walk very far). I was sad my stay was not longer as I felt the service and amenities at this hotel were top notch. Congratulations on having such wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you'd expect at an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: KLGri
Reviews.Content: I attended a 2-day meeting (one overnight stay) at this hotel, and the hotel far exceeded my expectations for an airport hotel. One of my expectations was that this would be a very sterile, utilitarian environment. Was I ever wrong! The lobby is welcoming, as is the staff,. The rooms are large, with great touches like the power shades that go up as you enter the room, and the bathroom (at least in my room) had both a tub and a separate shower. The catered food for the meetings was outstanding - fresh, flavorful, and with a Southwestern flair. My only "negative" would be that the service in the hotel restaurant was somewhat slow. Granted, we were there at an unusual time - 10 AM - but it took awhile to get our drinks and food (we were having a celebratory brunch). But once we told our server that we all had planes to catch, things got speedier, and the food was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Too convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Bloodman
Reviews.Content: They have perfected the business traveler hotel. This is it. Bathroom with separate shower. Total control of lights shades and temp from bed. Fast room service. Could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: rtprsd
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 5 friends on a reunion trip. We got connecting rooms with 2 queen sized beds in each room. The beds were very comfortable - the best beds by far! Very clean. Friendly service and the fact that its in the airport was very convenient. The best part was the view from the rooms- planes taking off and landing! No noise to go with the view & if you thought of sleeping in - double shaded blinds to keep the room dark.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Roselle N
Reviews.Content: I, unexcitedly, decided to stay here as a result of an early flight the following day. I was impressed from the moment I pulled up to the curb. The bellman was great, the front desk staff were extremely courteous and professional and the feeling I got was that I was in a boutique hotel not in the airport but in a very cosmopolitan city, etc. The room was awesome- very comfortable with flat screen TV, great bed etc. The Health Club on the top floor was equally great- mint equipment and the outdoor pool was really nice- granted your at the airport but it is so nice that you almost forget. Needless to say I really liked this place. The only negative obviously is that your captive to the hotel and their offerings but for a night or two you'll be very happy. Lastly, the room service was really quick and food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good.”
Reviews.Author: SamiSeppala
Reviews.Content: I felt little strange when i was reading reviews about how this hotel is citys best, but now i understand why. Very good service, comfortable beds, added with good restaurant and it is adjacent to terminal D, which makes it easy to get to plane. Business package costs 25$, which includes good breakfast and quite fast wireless. Drapes and sheers works electrically, nice to look planes coming and going, if one likes that kind of stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business stay when flying into DFW”
Reviews.Author: bubbafb
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is located in the DFW airport complex and can be accessed from the terminals. The experience from start to finish was great. Service was super. I asked to change rooms because the room facing the runway was a bit loud with the airplanes. An employee met me on the floor of my new room and offered to inspect it with me ... which I did not need. The concierge called a cab and walked me to the cab. Front desk & lounge personnel were top notch. The room was clean, modern & comfortable. Large bathroom, nice HD TV, comfortable bed. As a Hyatt Passport Platinum member the internet was free. The lounge is really nice and swanky. A bit pricey but what you would expect at a not notch hotel. A cup of coffee was available at the store for no charge during breakfast. The workout room was a good working order, nice machines with TVs. Headphones available. Nothing to complain about. The stay was very relaxing and enjoyable before a meeting in "uptown" Dallas (which is about a $46 + tip) cab ride. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NoleGirl0923
Reviews.Content: I state here one night on business and it was a great experience. The rooms were modern with all automated blinds and lights. Very spacious rooms with comfortable beds. Room service was good and fast service. The restaurant service was also great for breakfast. No complaints about this Hyatt!!

Reviews.Title: “very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: jennsastar
Reviews.Content: we ended up staying here not by choice but ended up loving it! we were on our way home from a second honeymoon trip to the bahamas when our connecting flight was cancelled due to a freak storm....after the HORRIBLE customer service american airlines gave us, we walked around the airport until we found this hotel! we got to the front desk and brittany was so AWESOME! we really couldnt afford to splurge on a crazy expensive hotel, but also didnt want to gallavant around town trying to find a cheap one, especially after traveling all day, and not having any luggage...so brittany helped us find an awesome military rate for my husband being in the airforce! she was super nice, and gave us toiletry kits and told us anything we wanted to know about the hotel! we ended up just getting room service for dinner because...lets be honest...i was wearing gym clothes to fly home in and didnt have any of my clothes, so i opted out of sitting downstairs with everyone looking so nice. the room service wasnt even that bad of a price! i had the cobb salad which was to DIE for...and a HUGE portion. the room was FABULOUS! one of the nicest hotels ive ever stayed at! so modern and comfortable super great! checkout was so quick and everyone thanked us for staying with them! if we ever get stuck in dallas again we know where we will stay :)

Reviews.Title: “No coffemaker in room is standard at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annie577
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there about a half a dozen times, and they have no coffeemaker in the room (not good), although they will have one put in your room if you request it. Even the lowest priced hotels have coffeemakers in the room! In addition, I liked the hotel better the way it was before it was renovated. The rooms almost look too modern; with no personality or warmth to the rooms, but it was definitely up-scale and very, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt DFW is an excellent airport hotel. It is directly attached to the airport, which makes for easy connection to flights. We stayed here for one night after arriving on a flight from London. Our room was large and quite comfortable. The bathroom was also very large and had a separate tub and shower. Our room had views of one of the DFW runways, so we were able to see planes land and take off. The sound insulation is excellent, so we did not hear the planes. The rooms are modern and clean. Service at the Grand Hyatt DFW was uniformly excellent. We had a room service dinner and breakfast at the hotel and found the food and food presentation to be interesting and full of flavor, which is not something we typically encounter in airport hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Taylor E
Reviews.Content: What a great stay. My husband and I after an extremely long trip from Germany , had a one night stay here. What a joy to not be able to hear all the planes from outside !!! the rooms are nice and modern. Kind of a retro style. It is right next to the terminal so we did not have to worry getting to our flight on time. Next time we come to Dallas we will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel right at DFW”
Reviews.Author: SuperTien
Reviews.Content: If you fly AA - you will love this hotel as it is right at DFW - great hotel - comfortable rooms, high thread count sheets, electric up down black out shades - nice touch. Perfect for early morn departures from DFW - great concierge service also.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly thrilled”
Reviews.Author: Max878
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to Dallas for a wedding this past weekend. I don't stay at Hyatt properties unless I have to, as a rule, because I haven't been happy with previous experiences. When I made these reservations I picked it for the location at the airport because our flight leaving Dallas was at 6am. When we arrived at DFW we did not go directly to the hotel but went and got our rental car. The DFW property is very large. We took a shuttle to the rental car location and then drove back to Terminal D where the Grand Hyatt is located. It is $25 to valet but self parking is free and really easy. You park in Terminal D on the same level as the front door of the hotel and there is a direct path to the Grand Hyatt escalators from the parking garage. My wife had an injury to her foot and they were able to get us a room next to an elevator but not right next to it. The room was a standard room but on their 8th floor facing the airport. The far wall is a whole window with automated sheers and blinds that open when the door to the room is opened. In fact all the lights were automated. The furnishings are modern and chic. The bed is amazingly comfortable with a posturpedic mattress. There is a chaise lounge also with plenty of seating, including two office chairs and an ottoman. The bathroom is expansive with a separate shower and tub. There is a mini bar. We ordered room service the following morning. Though my wife was still sleeping, the staff member Rachel, was quiet and able to arrange the table without being inconsiderate. Please note there is already an upcharge to the room service that includes gratuity. Roomservice is not 24 hours. We ordered room service for breakfast. I had the huevos rancheros, chicken sausage, coffee, and fresh berries. My wife had a crab and asparagus omelet with roasted potatoes and tea. The food was good, not excellent, but worth it. The berries were very fresh. The huevos rancheros I thought didn't have the spice I was expecting. My wife's omelet was better. The chicken sausage was processed into a horse shoe and a bit dry. I would pass on it. When you leave the airport, and I don't think this information is obvious on their website, is that you need to get a pass in and out of the airport grounds. To avoid paying any charges for parking you need an exit pass from the hotel each time you leave the airport. My wife and I would stay here again. It isn't hard to fly into a different terminal and get to the hotel and vice versa. We like this hotel for its style, the staff and its convenience. We didn't get a chance to see the work out area, which they have, as well as a pool. It is open 24 hours which is also helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelette
Reviews.Content: For an airport hotel, it is extremely quiet. The rooms are kind of a James Bond retro modern. Upon checking in, one has the urge to order a martini, shaken not stirred. The bath products are good, and the bed is comfortable. The main bar downstairs is well stocked, and a great place to mingle with friends. We have only eaten breakfast at the restaurant, but it is very good, and the buffet is more than adequate. I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice haven while in midst of travels”
Reviews.Author: srk3465
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Grand Hyatt DFW several times per year, either due to teavel mishaps(cancelled flights at DFW) or planned when I cannot get a late connecting flight but am still able to get to DFW and then I catch early morning connection. The hotel has always had great service along with great rooms. I say this because they recently renovated their rooms and while they are still very nice, personally I liked the older rooms better (they were not old to begin with). Service is exceptional. Front desk always with friendly interactions even despite the fact that many guests are sometimes "less then friendly" due to travel disruptions etc. I recently broke a bottle on my room floor and instead of coming to clean it, they came to move me to an upgraded room. Perhaps it was all that was available but it was more then I was expecting especially since it was my fault. Beds are exceptionally comfortable. Bathrooms have everything u need (even toothpaste). Their new electronic room controls for lights and window shades are nice and easy to use. All in all, it's a nice place to stay and sometimes I catch myself wishing for a delay or cancelation as an excuse to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and hip”
Reviews.Author: Kimbrahay
Reviews.Content: Just walked in to a lovely room with marble tiled floors that glisten. It leads to a spacious bathroom with an easy layout. One wrinkle (need a bit more light for makeup application) but it's overlooked since there is a huge mirror in the main room and a full wall of natural light from the huge windows. Speaking of windows, I'm sitting in front of them (hotel is at the airport) and the noise is negligible. A nice surprise for a hotel at the airport. One last thing, looking forward to using the yoga mat supplied in the closet for a nice bit of exercise while I'm here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best airport hotels in the US”
Reviews.Author: boraroma
Reviews.Content: An extraordinary hotel anywhere, but given it's right in Terminal D at DFW it makes this the only choice for me when going through DFW. Staff is on top of things, hotel restaurant and lobby area/bar has enough different spaces to be casual or have a more formal meal, rooms are high end, very soundproof, and great gym and rooftop pool, and added bonus for a hotel gym is the steam room. Pretty aweome all around.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been happier!”
Reviews.Author: SpaceyT
Reviews.Content: First of all we wound up with this hotel through one of those bidding sites where you don't know the specific hotel you'll get, just the star rating. I was not happy at all when I found out that our hotel for Labor Day Weekend was actually inside the airport (terminal D). With that said I have to tell you how PLEASANTLY surprised I was with the hotel and the staff. This hotel is beautiful! The staff was very friendly and quite helpful as well. The beds were comfortable and I loved all the electronics. It was a big treat for the kids to touch a button beside the bed and have the lights come on, the a/c turn down, and the shades drawn. We also had a great view of the planes taking off. You would think that being that close to the planes would be very noisy but let me assure you that you won't hear anything from your room. You don't hear people going up and down the halls, showers running from other rooms or any noisy neighbors above you. Nothing but blissful silence. The maid service was wonderful too. I know that the next time we go to Dallas/FT Worth for anything I willl DEFINITELY stay here again! A++

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to Christmas trip...”
Reviews.Author: 217mami14
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, and then speaking with a staff member over the phone - who gave me loads of information and advice about the area - I decided to go with the Grand Hyatt over other hotels by the airport. I was truly pumped about my future stay there after speaking with "M". Thank you for your help and pleasant disposition! Now, does anyone know of any car rental companies near Terminal D/Grand Hyatt? I'd like to walk there in the morning to pick up my car to head out to the game.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crestwicke
Reviews.Content: Wow, this is a convenient and awesome hotel. As a single, I went down to dinner and thought I would be stuck in a corner, instead they have some great bar type areas where the singles can have a great dining experience. The food was great, wine prices expensive, but oh well. I was very happy with the hotel and the restaurant

Reviews.Title: “This is one luxury everyone must experience!”
Reviews.Author: IcebergDeeva
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times. Everytime has been amazing. I was not surprised at all that this hotel is currently rated Number 1. If you ever get stuck in Dallas, trust me, it is worth it to experience this hotel. Everything is amazing. The staff goes above and beyond to assist it's guests. EVERY dish that I've ever tasted in the restaurant is amazing. The MOKA coffee bar drink selections are great. The bar signature drinks are extremely tasty. Room service is magnificent. I live in Dallas, and with ALL of the hotels in the the DFW area, it is a luxury for me to spend a getaway at...of all places...the airport. The rooms are quiet and believe me I can't hear any airplanes. I stress again, if you ever get stuck in Dallas, if you plane is ever cancelled, take the airport shuttle to the Grand Hyatt DFW (there is another Hyatt at DFW, it's nice but I choose the Grand Hyatt everytime) and relax until the following morning, or next available flight. Everything you could possibly want is there and everything is done in Excellence. My favorite hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “An Airport Oasis”
Reviews.Author: theheadland
Reviews.Content: We first enjoyed the Grand Hyatt DFW during a 4 hour layover. The cocktail bar was an oasis of calm comfort, greart service, drinks and food. Going home, we missed our connecting flight and were standed at DFW at 10.30pm. It was such a relief to be able to walk up to the GH after a stressful afternoon of flight delays and missed connections. The room was stunning - integrated electronic contols for lights, curtains, air cond - very impressive. A full room service meal at 11pm was also very welcome. The bathroom is amazing - huge, lots of marble, more electronic controls. Determined not to miss our rescheduled flight, we checked in 4 hrs early and had a finbal dinner at GH. It was also excellent. We left thinking that we were very lucky to be standed at The Grand Hyatt - everything was impeccible and it's a destination in its own right.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home. A relaxing business trip”
Reviews.Author: globbiztravel
Reviews.Content: Made more relaxing by the professional staff at the hotel. I have never stayed at an airport connected hotel. The hotelnwas beautiful and well appointed too. I loved the room, the bed, the tv, the bathroom and the great view of the runway. The staff was excellent as was room service, restaurant service and the food. The gym was new and modern and had plenty of resources and there was an outdoor pool on the roof. Very easy to get to the hotel at Terminal D at DFW.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kcoffin
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old daughter stayed at the DFW Grand Hyatt for one night before and after a summer trip to the Virgin Islands. The hotel was so convenient....just steps from American Airlines ticketing and security in Terminal D. We had an early morning flight out and it was so easy to just take the escalator down and be on our way! We also returned fro our trip late at night, and we were so happy to be able to just take the escalator up from baggage claim and be at the hotel. The newly refurbished rooms were great looking, comfortable and high tech. I loved being able to turn off all of the room lights from a console on my bedside nightstand. It was fun watching planes take off and land from our big window. The bathrooms were large (separate shower and tub). They have a GREAT and reasonably priced kid's room service menu which included cookies and milk, pancakes, soup, mac and cheese, etc. The service was excellent. They made my daughter and I very happy and comfortable. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: ozscot
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night while travelling between Sydney Australia and Panama City Panama. Recently refurbished room was soundproof and comfortable. Staff were helpful and extremely pleasant. No transport worries as hotel is inside terminal D.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable. Worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: allidoistravel
Reviews.Content: This is a very convenient property within Terminal D at the Dallas-Fort Worth airport. I had stayed at this hotel multiple times since it opened, usually for an overnight in transit, but this time I spent two nights there during a business trip to Dallas rather than use another property outside the airport. I was not disappointed. The welcome from the check-in staff was efficient, warm and friendly. The room was the usual excellent Hyatt accommodation with absolutely no aircraft noise even though the airport was its usual busy self. My experience in the restaurant was first class: service, food and ambience. Service throughout my stay was excellent from all staff members. Not only can one not beat the convenience (security is at the bottom of the hotel escalator) but this Grand Hyatt is certainly not the usual in-airport hotel. It's really an airport resort!

Reviews.Title: “This was a wonderfully convenient hotel and a very good value”
Reviews.Author: nonstop_8
Reviews.Content: We recently needed to overnight near DFW airport to catch a connecting flight the following a.m. We have stayed at hotels in "Hotel Circle" north of DFW before, but it is always just a little hassle having to wait for the shuttle and go and return on a schedule. We chose the DFW Grand Hyatt because we were coming in on a late flight and did not want to spend any more time than necessary getting to the hotel.This place was ideal! Our flight came into Terminal D and we walked only a short ways inside the terminal to be at check in for the Grand Hyatt. The front desk was extremely efficient and helpful. The room was beautiful! The bed was very comfortable and the room was well appointed. Arriving late meant we had not eaten, so I went downstairs at 11:30 p.m. to the bar and they offered to fix anything on the menu and let me take it back to the room.
