The next a.m. we went in for breakfast. The hostess and servers were very cheerful. My wife really liked the breakfast. She had scrambled eggs and raved about the salsa that came on the side. She also liked the little finger potatoes. The OJ was really good too. Tasted fresh squeezed. When we finished breakfast, we grabbed our bags and caught the skylink to our gate. We will stay here again! So convenient!

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay anywhere else when flying out of DFW.”
Reviews.Author: PrayingMother
Reviews.Content: We reserved Park and Fly with the hotel. You are not restricted to seven days; you just have to pay for any extra time. Valet service is not available with this option but parking was easy in the covered parking deck just across the drive. We stopped at the hotel entrance to unload our luggage and request assistance. Check-in was a breeze. Loyalty to a particular hotel chain has its perks, but I'm sure they would have been just as gracious to any guest. The porter provided us with fresh ice before leaving, which was a nice touch. The refrigerator had drinks/snacks for a fee which is prominently displayed so there are no surprises. I would have preferred to have an empty refrigerator, but to be fair, I did not ask for one. Our corner room overlooked the runway, as requested. The room was as large as a premium Hyatt resort room. The bath was the largest I've seen in any hotel chain. It was well-appointed with a separate tub and a large shower. (I don't believe I've ever stayed anywhere that had a laundry hamper!) I loved that there was enough room for two get dressed at the same time. As a hotel guest, you can request entrance behind security in the airport. The desk clerk called security. They came, filled out forms on my husband and me, and escorted us through the security line. It was required since we did not have boarding passes that we go through the usual security procedures and submit to a pat-down. The security personnel were professional and I was not offended in the least. After you have passed through security you have access to all the terminals through Skylink (which is very, very fast). All shops and restaurants are available to you. If you haven't been to DFW, there are many choices of restaurants. There are boards which tell what is available in every terminal. Pappadeaux's is located in Terminal B (I believe) and is situated on a lower level. It feels like a "real" restaurant, not an airport eatery. It was quiet, relaxed and had booths and tables without people running into you with their carryon luggage. After dinner we strolled through the terminals to get some exercise. It was nice of the Grand Hyatt to secure this privilege for their guests. We could have eaten at our hotel or taken the airport bus outside of security to the Hyatt Regency which is also located on airport property. With 2 hotels and all of the airport, you definitely have a lot of choices for dining if you stay at the Grand Hyatt. We ate breakfast in the formal hotel restaurant. The food and service were on par with a 5-star hotel. It was a wonderful way to start our day before a long flight. I'd go back just to eat breakfast. And next time, I will be sure and made time for the restaurant and bar at the Grand Hyatt - -

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding all around.”
Reviews.Author: Chipleeiii
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Manchester Grand Hyatt, the Fukuoka Grand Hyatt, and now the DFW GRand Hyatt and it is always such a pleasure. The rooms are modern, clean and immaculate, but the staff is what really sets these hotels apart. Friendly, attentive, thoughtful, you name it, they get it. There are enough stressors in a traveler's day without them becoming another one. For example, when I ordered room service they said it would take about 30 minutes, and when it showed up in 15 the person delivering it apologized for being early. That may seem trivial, but I had tried to squeeze in a shower between ordering and delivery, and when that shower was interrupted, the fact that the delivery person knew what time I was expecting my food, and thought too apologize for being early, meant the difference between my being irritated or my stoked to have my food already. Aside from that, use Fast Board, eat the food, drink the wine, get the massage, you won't regret a minute of your time here.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom as big as the room”
Reviews.Author: wolfden
Reviews.Content: The first thing you need to know about this hotel is that it is in a terminal that has nothing. No place to eat or shop. Once you are at the hotel, you have to take a "long" shuttle to another terminal or stay in your room. Unfortunately the front desk people did not mention this option to us (in hopes that we would eat in their restaurant I'm sure). There is a restaurant in the hotel but it's extremely expensive. My meal alone was $60 and nothing special. Probably good for the business traveler on an expense account (which I was). The other thing to be warned about is that the "free" shuttle doesn't start until 6:00am. We happened to have an early flight and needed to be at another terminal at 5:30am. Fortunately the concierge and front desk people made special arrangements to have a shuttle start early that day. The hotel itself was quite nice and the room was clean. Everything (including internet) costs in this place but the bathroom amenities help make up for that. Very high quality soaps etc. I would guess that the bathroom was 12 feet by 12 feet and the shower was at least 4 feet by 4 feet. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. But because of the lack of shops and eating facilities, I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: dallastexas76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay here once or twice a year when we have an early flight. We're big fans of the Caribbean, and even though we live 15 minutes from the airport, it's so much easier to start the vacation early and already be at the airport for the very early check in for the 545 to Miami. The hotel is in terminal D, but you could easily hop on the skylink inside the secure area and be in another terminal in minutes. The Hyatt Regency is nice too, but the Grand takes the cake. The front desk staff is polite and helpful. Everything about the hotel is still new. There is a nice restaurant downstairs, but we usually sit at the bar and split an appetizer and burger. Airport prices of course, but not too outrageous. We always book a room with a runway view, and never have problems with noise. The two best attributes of this hotel are the gym and the pool. The gym has plenty of equipment, machines, etc. and the towels are neatly placed for you throughout the gym. The pool is great also. Small, but functional. The loungers are good quality, and there are also tables to sit at. The pool is on the roof (not the top, but maybe the third of fourth floor), and has a glass pane wall so you can see the airplanes coming in and going out. No drink service is available, but we just make our own in plastic cups and bring them with us. I will be booking a room here in December for our trip to Anguilla!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise elegant at airport”
Reviews.Author: Robertjrjr
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt at DFW was a welcomed surprise after a long transatlantic flight. The rooms were well appointed and the restaurant was also a pleasant experience! Highly recommended for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convienent”
Reviews.Author: Bippie
Reviews.Content: Due to a last minute flight change, I needed to spend a night at DFW to make a connection from an international flight to a domestic flight on American Airlines. When I initially searched for DFW hotels, I limited my choices to the Hyatt Regency DFW and the Grand Hyatt DFW. The Grand Hyatt was about 30% more expensive but after reviewing TripAdvisor I realized the extra cost was worth it. After clearing customs, I simply took a nearby elevator to the lobby of the Grand Hyatt DFW. Check-in was simple and I was in the room very quickly. The oversized elevators were great since I had a lot of luggage. My room was a deluxe king on the 8th floor and it was spacious. Having just arrived from London, I was ready to do the minimum that would get me into the bed and allow me to sleep. The extra-high ceilings meant the curtains were also extra-high but the rods made it easy to close them. I had a view over the parking area and never heard outside noises. The Hyatt bed was as comfortable as usual and I immediately went to sleep. When I woke I realized it was daylight but the curtains kept the room sufficiently dark. Even though there was no coffee maker in the room, there was a card stating you could ask for one or simply go to the lobby for a fresh cup of Illy coffee. Good coffee! Went to the lobby for breakfast and was impressed with the modern, miminal decor of the lobby restaurant. Breakfast was great - they had really cool coffee/tea cups. The breakfast I ordered could have fed a family of four. The server kept refilling the glass of fresh-squeezed orange juice. Nice selection of newspapers, too. Breakfast could not have been better and it was included in my AAA rate. Returning to the room for a shower I realized the bathroom was also spacious. Double sink, tub, separate shower. Plenty of hot water and enough towels. The entire time I was at the hotel, I could not believe this was in my terminal. This hotel really allows you to escape the airport. Checked out at noon and took the elevator to the terminal. The check-in counter for domestic flights (American) was unbelievably close. I'm glad I paid the extra for the Grand Hyatt because I did not have to catch a shuttle to a hotel. The convienence was well worth the extra dollars to me. The hotel was clean, quiet, and comfortable. I would stay at this hotel again and wish all Hyatts could be this nice and well-run.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Layover and Outstanding Service!”
Reviews.Author: Pigsterz
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the tip on the Trip Advisor Dallas forum for convincing us that staying at the Grand Hyatt was worth the premium rate over other nearby but off-airport hotels. It was worth it for the convenience alone. Both our incoming flight the night we stayed over, and our outbound flight leaving the next day were in Terminal D, so the Grand Hyatt couldn't have been more convenient... just an escalator ride away. The service was superb! The staff were all very welcoming and friendly. Our incoming flight was delayed and we got to the hotel about 20 minutes before the restaurant and cafe/bar closed. We wanted just a light meal so we grabbed a sandwich and salad to take back to our room from the cafe. The young lady that was helping us couldn't have been more nicer. The room is exactly as described and shown on their site, very spacious, and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom had a separate shower and bathtub, with great water pressure in the shower. We had a room that overlooked one of the runways so we were able to see planes landing and taking off the next morning prior to checking out. Pretty neat. No noise issues at all in the room. We would definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt DFW again. We only wish the airport hotel in MIA is as nice as this, as that is usually the airport where we have a layover on our way to the Caribbean islands.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you need to be at the airport”
Reviews.Author: jenny2424
Reviews.Content: We had a long road trip and Dallas was the perfect spot to stay, right about in the middle. This hotel was great and we needed it to just crash. Jody at the front dest was very helpful and gave us a larger room when she saw we were travelling with small children as well as sending up cookies and milk for us. She really went out of her way to make us feel welcome and since we were travelling on the Expedia rate I completely didn't expect it. She made our night! If you go to the pool watch out! The tiles are very slippery when wet!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Swarton
Reviews.Content: Just an escalator ride up from the middle of the international terminal at DFW. High quality international business hotel. Large room. Nice lounge and restaurant. Oddly, no coffee maker in room, but one is promptly delivered on request. Rooftop pool is small, with stark white deck, blindingly bright in the Texas sun; needs more shade and greenery. Front desk, concierge, and bellman exceptionally friendly and helpful. Bellman even insisted on carrying our bags over to the airline desk and assisting with check-in, and he was quite knowledgeable about the details. I was impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Except for Food Poisoning”
Reviews.Author: TWA_Guy
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to the Grand Hyatt DFW. As a Plat I was given a fantastic corner room with an amazing view of the airfield. The rooms at this hotel are perfectly appointed and very functional for business travelers. I didn't visit the gym on this stay but love how the treadmills look out onto runways on the other side. The staff is also very helpful and professional. That being said, I had dinner with my clients at Grand Met, the only restaurant in the hotel. I had asparagus soup and sea bass which were both delicious but found myself very sick about 4-5 hours later. I was feeling a little better by our 0730 meeting but generally weak and out of sorts for our later meeting. The hotel staff were very aplogetic and asked what they could do but I just wanted to make sure the message was relayed to the restaurant so no one else suffered. Hopefully this was just a fluke as I love this hotel for visits to the DFW area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Best Business Hotel in the US.”
Reviews.Author: jherman06
Reviews.Content: Third stay...How often can one say that staying at an airport is a total pleasure? it is here...Rooms, sophisticated service, excellent food and amenities. Wonderful in every way...An oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Luxury at DFW”
Reviews.Author: Tellurian
Reviews.Content: After a long travel day, with an early flight departure ahead, it's great to just roll your bags up the escalator of Terminal D right into the Grand Hyatt. The room was stylish, well-outfitted and comfortable. I dinged sleep quality a notch because room temp was a bit warm for the comforter on the bed. The food and drink options in the hotel restaurant were pricey, but excellent. Very nice desk staff and concierge. We got a sweet deal through Priceline, but my husband was so taken with the Grand Hyatt that I might have to book directly if we find ourselves overnight at DFW again. We had to transfer to Terminal A in the morning for our flight, but the airport is well-connected through a bus service and airlink; the concierge provided instructions for both options.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault this hotel, but no free internet in this day and age?”
Reviews.Author: Marks281172
Reviews.Content: Had a 1 night lay over on my way to Wichita from the UK last week and chose the Grand Hyatt DFW as i didnt want to be waiting for a Shuttle bus or getting a cab to another Hotel after a 10 hour flight. It is what you would expect of a high end hotel. It is immaculately kept and the service is first class. I had a King room on the 2nd floor and loved it, the separate shower was a nice change and a real treat. I was lucky enough to have good weather on the afternoon i arrived so had a dip in the rooftop pool, a great experience, i didnt use the gym as i tend to pass out if i train directly after a long flight but it looked well equipped. I chose to have dinner off site, I wanted somewhere informal to eat as I was travelling alone and wouldnt feel comfortable eating in plush full service restaurant. There is a bar but none of the bar food tempted me, i wanted a good steak and a bud light and some sports on a TV to watch. Not really a criticism i guess as that isnt the theme of this hotel but i do think a bit more variety in dining options would be nice. The one criticism i do have however is i did not have free internet and had to pay $9.99 to have 24 hour internet access. Its been a long time since Ive stayed anywhere in the US that didn't have free internet access in the rooms and public areas, so its strange this upscale business centric hotel does not provide it for its guests. Breakfast in the morning was superb, i would say its the best ive had in the US anywhere. Overall id say for an overnight or conference this is a perfect hotel and not to pricey given what you get, but for a longer stay I would probably go off airport to have better variety of eateries. And please Hyatt, spend a few $'s and give your guests internet access, if motels charging $50 or less a night can manage it, im sure you can!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at DFW”
Reviews.Author: EagleDad
Reviews.Content: Flew into DFW and stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a meeting the next day. The hotel is top notch all the way around. While you will pay close to $300 per night the rooms are very quiet - even being located in the middle of DFW. The rooms are spacious and the work desk is set up with extra plugs, internet, etc. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are large with a seperate tub and shower. Ate in the restaurant and had very good food. Upon arriving at DFW the hotel was in another terminal but the train system will shuttle you right to the hotel. This is a great location is you need easy access to DFW.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to consider in your next trip”
Reviews.Author: Marianotg
Reviews.Content: Made a little search in Tripadvisor and found out that this Hotel had good reviews. It is more expensive than the surrounding Hotels but it is worth it. Big room, huge bathroom, extraordinary service from the employees. First Class fitness room ! Complimentary Coffee and newspaper. Arrived at concourse D with AA and the Hotel was right there !! The next morning I had an early flight and thought it may depart from the same concourse. I was wrong ! my gate was in concourse A. After passing the checkpoint (15 min) I had to take the Skylink Train and I almost lost my plane !! Verify your gate early to estimate your time !

Reviews.Title: “THANK YOU GRISELLE ROMERO”
Reviews.Author: Babydocswife
Reviews.Content: My husband is on his way to his third deployment for the US Army. We spent Valentine's weekend together in Dallas. Our room was amazing. You would never know you were in an airport...unless you looked out the window to watch the planes take off. So quiet. Griselle and the rest of the staff provide the best in customer service. We ate in the hotel dining room, wonderful. Top notch customer service. The best. Lemon drop drink from the hotel lounge/bar is a must have. Thank you personally, Griselle, for the special efforts to make our stay so amazing. We will never forget your kindness....and the band-aids for my finger!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dklee1977iowa
Reviews.Content: Overnighted here during a layover. Travelled with my wife and two small children. They put a crib in the room complete with Teddy bear. They also put baby shampoo etc. in the bathroom. Room service was exceptional. Great Hotel overall with absolutely no complaints. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “JUST STAY HERE, BEST IS AREA BY FAR”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller23_11
Reviews.Content: Best hotel in area by far, new, clean, quiet, great service. Pool and spa very good.

Reviews.Title: “Best Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johanna2116
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of this hotel. I've been here at least 5 times and I've never had a bad experience. First of all - the location cannot be beat. It's connected to terminal D in the airport. Go through the security check point on the ground floor and you're there. Because the location is so incredible you might think that there will be a trade off in another area but I haven't found it. The hotel decor is beautiful and elegant, the rooms are clean and roomy, bathrooms are beautiful and big. The food is excellent in the restaurant, catering and room service. Everything a business traveler could want. I highly recommend it, I've never been disappointed and you won't be either!

Reviews.Title: “good for what it is”
Reviews.Author: dieWelt1
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay at the airport, this is a convenient option. The rooms are clean, and we couldn't hear any noise from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Dallas/Ft Worth”
Reviews.Author: Vangieplarkin
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Grand Hyatt 3 times now and we are NEVER disappointed! the cleanest rooms & bathrooms; the most comfortable beds and quiet rooms; so convenient to catch a flight or to see our son off on a morning flight; Breakfast downstairs is an experience in itself. Food and service are wonderful. If we could change one thing, it would be to add a Starbucks in the lobby, instead of the coffee brand that's there now.....

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: sb1099
Reviews.Content: Convenient to the airport, perfect for an overnight stay or short business meeting. Otherwise like any other Hyatt, an average business hotel. Internet connectivity in conference rooms was poor. I was most impressed by the service, I missed the shuttle to the airport and the bell person dropped me to the airport in his personal car.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Ambience and service”
Reviews.Author: sudhir_m_r
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, recommended, a clean, touchy, staff, excellent food, swimming pool, courtsey, a higly appreciable hotel chain across the globe with spirit of customer service and elegancy. The name is enough !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location for travellers”
Reviews.Author: MrFix3
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times for meetings. Generally speaking, airport hotels are just adequate, or they are overpriced. The DFW Grand Hyatt is an exception to that rule. The staff was courteous and helpful, the restaurant had wonderful food choices, and the rooms are comfortable and quiet. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Quiet, In-terminal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: comebacktotexas
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times on nights prior to early morning flights out of DFW. It's right in Terminal D, which makes it easy to go right into the terminal to check-in or take transportation to a different terminal if need be. The hotel is relatively new, well-maintined, clean, with good in-room amenities. The hotel staff has always been very friendly and helpful. Rooms can be a bit pricey, so check for special rates, promotions, etc. Otherwise, I'd highly recommend the Grand Hyatt and I'm sure we'll be returning the next time we're flying out early.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we missed our connecting flight”
Reviews.Author: lazolleca
Reviews.Content: So - we missed our connecting flight, the last one out of DFW that day, and thought we were completely stuck. Before I could have a jet lagged meltdown the gate agent directed us up the escalator and into the lobby of the Hyatt. What a wonderful resting spot! It was very late at night, and yet the hotel was fully staffed, we checked in no problem and within 20 minutes dragged room service and cocktails up to the pool area. The bed was extremely comfortable and the rooms were silent. No jet rumblings, even though we were in the terminal. Our luggage had made the connection, so we had nothing. The front desk was prepared and handed us little kits with toothbrushes, slippers, razors, etc. They were prepared for cranky jet lagged folks and handled us graciously. The next morning we just rolled out and down the escalator, walked a few yards to the gate and finally made our flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Great People-Great Property”
Reviews.Author: spudpicker1
Reviews.Content: I had some reservations about staying at an airport property, especially when there were full service properties close by. I was so glad I chose to stay here. I arrived on Friday and departed Monday. I received a weekend AAA rate of $157.00 the first 2 nights and stayed using Hyatt points the 3rd night of my stay. My room was very spacious and facing the runway, which I requested. You can hear engine noise but it really is quite muffled due to the great job of noise isolation. Check-in was quick and flawless. I was upgraded to a 2 room suite due to my status with Hyatt. The room was very spacious and had a large Plasma TV and desk.. The bedding was extremely comfortable and for once I stayed at a property that had what I consider to be the most comfortable pillows. Whats the use of having comfortable beds if the pillows are stiff or floppy, right? The bathroom had a walkin shower and a seperate bathtub. There was a granite topped sink with all the amenities including a travel size tube of toothpaste and a bottle of Scope mouthwash as well as soaps. moisterizers and shampoo. The shower spray volume was very good. The towels were soft and absorbant. The room temperature air conditioner was set to a minimum of 65 degrees. it was quiet and extremely efficient. The restaurant/lounge areas are connected. I had Breakfast and Dinner and the waitstaff was not only competant and efficient, but also extremely courteous and friendly. Sometimes this is hard to accomplish without coming across as being phony, but everyone's genuine goal was to make you feel as comfortable as possible. They accomplished this. If you want to see things you do need to rent a car. I learned from checking out rental rates a month ago that if you rent cars during the weekend on the same day as the rental, you will get some last minute, almost desperate rates just so they can earn some money. I needed a car for Saturday and Sunday. I secured a rental car from Advantage Rent a Car(a subsidiary of Hertz) for $5.00 each day. Thats $10.00 total for 2 days plus taxes which were a lot more than the rental rate. I picked up the car on Saturday morning and returned it Sunday afternoon. If I remember correctly the parking was $19.00 so this was extremely affordable. There are a ton of restaurants and shopping malls in nearby Grapevine. Downtown Dallas took me about 25 minutes to get to once I left the rental center.Six Flags Amusement park, Arlington Stadium and the new Dallas Cowboy Stadium are located in the same area and only 15 minutes from the airport. If I'm in the area again, this is the place I'm going to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, good food, good value, conveniently located in the DFW airport”
Reviews.Author: BitsyIllinois
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for business meetings/conferences. The staff were exceptional. They tended to all the details, making our meeting a success. The food was excellent. The only drawback to staying at this hotel, is that you are "stuck" there unless you rent a car to take a shuttle into the city, which is about 25 miles away. But, if you are flying in for a meeting at the hotel, it is a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great cooking classes”
Reviews.Author: Love-to-wander-Mom
Reviews.Content: Twice now my spouse and I have enjoyed the monthly cooking class at this hotel. It is so private (4-8 guests have 3.5 hours with the executive chef and at least 1-2 other chefs in the main kitchen) and informational. (You don't even have to take notes because they film the whole thing and send you a DVD with recipes.) Plus at the end of the class you enjoy a 4 course lunch with at least 2 wines. Everyone is so friendly and so professional without being stuffy. It is all 5 star. Luckily we live in town so we can enjoy this whenever we wish, but if you are at the hotel for the weekend, we strongly recommend you try this. We have been to other classes and have never enjoyed them as much. There is also a weekend package that they offer which includes the class, several meals and a massage. I am sure that would be perfect for an anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “higher end hotel in terminal D”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller2
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights while conducting business in Dallas. Decided to stay at DFW because of early morning flight back to LAX. Hotel is very modern. My room was quite new and everything worked well and was clean. There was a separate regular tub and a stand up shower. The bath was done in black granite tiles - very elegant. Had some minor snafus with staff - I was sent a fax and it took a day to get to me despite asking several times about it - no one knew it was there for me - also some delay with a drink at the bar resulting in a complimentary drink. My meal at the restaurant was excellent - rack of lamb. Restaurant service was excellent. The restaurant and bar are very elegant. You have the option to sit at a private TV while in the bar - something I have not seen before. The restaurant brought me a cute little book light to read by since I was sitting alone. A nice touch I had not seen before. The hotel room comes with a decent selection in the minibar, at a price of course. Hotel is right at terminal D and the security lines were never long there - it was easy to get in there. One unexpected issue was the vast size of the DFW property - I had to get a rental car and drive into town. It took me 1.5 hours door to door from my room to the place I was going in town. Mainly because one has to wait for the rental car bus - ride the bus, then get the car - then my directions to my location were from the north side of DFW but the cars live on the south side and it takes some time just to drive from one end of the property to the other. But this is not the fault of the hotel - just something to be aware of if you are staying at DFW. Hotel comes with e-checkin and e-checkout. I did both - the latter turns out they did not list my gold passport number so I am waiting to hear from them about crediting the stay - it was on the original reservation. I suggest to watch the bill carefully - they billed me for the fax while it was still lost to me so I had to ask to have that charge removed because I did not receive the fax when it was billed. Apparently someone got the fax, charged me for it, and then did not connect with anyone else in the hotel to let me know it had arrived or to arrange for it to come to my room. On top of that, the bill did not mention a fax per se - just business center which I had not been to and did not know even existed. In terms of sleep quality my room was exceedingly quiet. I asked for a quiet room I was put on the 7th floor facing terminal C. I could see the other hyatt in the distance and the planes taking off on the runway behind the other hyatt. I could not hear the planes or much else. There was no noise from the nearby rooms or from the hallway either. There was a conference of engineering fellows from Raytheon while I was there I guess they are a quiet bunch thankfully. I think the hotel was full when I was there but you could not tell except for the lively business in the bar and restaurant. My bed was comfortable. I asked for no feathers and got that. However I had trouble with allergies in my room I am not sure what it was from I took antihistamine the second night which fixed the allergies but kept me awake. The A/C works exceedingly well however it does blow directly on the bed which might have been part of the problem. I had a AAA rate of $207-237/night during my two nights. It was one of the most expensive properties around but also the one with the best reviews and most convenient to DFW.

Reviews.Title: “This Hyatt really Stands out as a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Consultantgal
Reviews.Content: This hotel stands out for both room cleanliness (which has taken a hit in so many big hotels) and in service. The room was the cleanest hotel room I've stayed in in years. It was also comfortable and nicely done. The only reason I marked the hotel down on sleep was that even on the 18th floor you can still hear the train outside. Service was impecable. I was running a conference at the hotel and the staff went above and beyond on every possible measure. I will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Morning Train
Reviews.Content: Wonderful access to and from the airport terminals. It is closest to the best serviced one. This hotel is so good that it would be worth choosing an itinerary via DFW. The transport to and from the airlines is quick and easy to find. Being able to check in downstairs for onward American Airlines flight was a real bonus. The restaurant has some individual TV screens for those who prefer this. The menu was five-star priced but fair value. The a la carte breakfast was a surprise but a refreshingly peaceful change from jumping up and down for morning buffet. There is another Hyatt at DFW. On a future stopover I'd be careful that I booked for the Grand Hyatt as this is the one which is nearest to the airlines. I'd readily choose route and dates to benefit from this facility.

Reviews.Title: “CONVENIENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Cheezel
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as a stopover point before traveling on. This hotel was within the airport and as a functional convenient short stop was excellent. The rooms were clean, the breakfast good and airport check in almost in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “They Think of Everything!”
Reviews.Author: amlash
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel after reading all of the superlavite reviews and I was not disappointed. It is a business traveler's dream! The rooms are immaculate and comfortable with great bath products. Coffe/breakfast start very early to accommodate those who are on the go. The lobby bar/cafe is excellent and very handy for late arrivals who do not want to use room service. I wish there was a similarly great hotel in every major airport!

Reviews.Title: “We've stayed here a dozen times; great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Raisingcain
Reviews.Content: This hotel is, very simply, one of the finest hotels at which we have ever stayed. They raise the bar for everyone else, even for other Grand Hyatts! The service is incredible, the runway views are spectacular, and the location makes it great to be able to jump in the car and reach anywhere in the Dallas - Ft. Worth area within 1/2 hour. The workout facilities are among the best you will find in any hotel, including a great locker room which is mildly reminiscent of some of the great Vegas spas. One thing that I haven't seen mentioned in any other reviews is the noise level in the rooms. Hyatt has done a great job of engineering most of the noise out of the rooms, no small feat considering their proximity to dozens of jets taking off every hour. For aviation enthusiasts, be sure to ask for a runway view; it is among the best in the nation and there are many smartphone apps that will allow you to listen to the air traffic controllers simultaneously. A really great hotel; fantastic job, Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Large airport hotel conveniently located at terminal D”
Reviews.Author: berniss
Reviews.Content: Even though I am a platinum member, the only perk offered was free internet. There wasn't even free water. Service was fine, but there were no upgrades available at all. The room was comfortable and overlooked the landing strip, which was fun. The room felt new and was was nicely appointed and a good size. Terminals for printing out your boarding pass was readily available and you are very close to the airport skytrain. You get through security very quickly right under the hotel. I wasn't overwhelmed by the hotel compared to others that I used during the business trip, but it was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Annie577
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - the only problem with this hotel is that they don't have coffeemakers in the room. The good news is if you ask for one to be placed in your room before your arrival, they will indeed put a coffeemaker in your room.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: Geekontherun
Reviews.Content: They really strive for perfection! This is one of my favorite hotels I stay at! They care period! They know all their frequent travelers by name! They know all your preferences when you get there. The extra pillows are in your room as you prefer along with any amenities you ask for. Room service is amazing! They remember all your favorites. I have to tell you I was sick during my visit. They sent me up tea with mint lemon cinnamon and it made me feel so much better. It was like being home but oh so much better. They really treat you like the goddess you know you are! They have a state of the art workout room, have fabulous massages (which I have on previous trips), valet parking, are close to grapevine mills. You can easily get to all the major cities around Dallas and Fort Worth from the hotel. I have stayed here so often and receive consistent excellent service throughout the hotel! They are the bar that I hold other hotels as a standard to! WELL WORTH EVERY PENNY! You sleep like a baby!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Solotravelismything
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice recently and both were very good experiences. I stayed in April the night before a flight to New York City after a three-hour drive from Shreveport, La. On that stay, I got the "sleep.park.fly." option which saved me about $20 on parking. Normally I stay in a hotel near the airport and park in the remote lot. This time I was able to park right next to Terminal D where the hotel is located. It was by no means cheap, but the hotel is first rate all the way. The rooms are big and immaculately clean. It's just a few steps to check-in and security from the lobby escalators. If you're flying out of another terminal it's a quick trip on Skylink from Terminal D. I went back to Dallas and Fort Worth on Memorial Day weekend. I didn't plan to stay here again but I used Priceline for the first time and got this hotel. Honestly, the rate was almost $100 less than the listed rate on Hyatt's web site and about $200 less than I paid in April. Wow. This time, unlike the first trip, I was given a room overlooking the runways. I have to admit I enjoyed watching the planes come and go. The rooms aren't completely soundproof. You can hear the muffled roar of the engines but it really didn't bother me at all. Also, you are allowed to go into the secured area of the airport as a guest of the hotel. All you do is go to the front desk or concierge and they call an officer to come get you and take you to security. I might say here that the Hyatt staff is very attentive to your needs. The officer has to fill out a form but it only took me about 20 minutes from the time I came downstairs until the time I went through security. When I got to the first security checker I was escorted by a TSA officer straight to the metal detectors checkpoint area and went right through. There are many good places to shop and eat at Terminal D. The officer did say that if you wanted to come out of the secured area and go back in later you had to go through the whole process again. He told me that it was best to do it before 8 p.m. I didn't sample the restaurant but they do have a 24-hour area that sells pastry and sandwiches and soft drinks which I utilized when I got back to the hotel late Saturday. The only downside is that I did have to pay for airport parking. That added $23 to the bill but considering the rate I got it was still a bargain. I went to DFW to see a play at the Music Hall at Fair Park and to go the final round of the Colonial PGA event in Fort Worth. An airport hotel might not seem to be the best location for this, but really the freeways get you around the Metroplex pretty quick and there's easy access from the airport. But beware that the traffic can look clear one minute and be backed up the next. It took me about a half-hour to get from the airport to the I-30, I-35, I-45 interchange, and it took me an hour from there to get to Fair Park which was probably just another five miles. But that was because there was a Brooks and Dunn concert that night at the Superpages venue, which is also in Fair Park. It was maybe a little over 30 minutes to the Colonial in very light traffic. All in all, I would definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt again regardless of what my plans are.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel Great location”
Reviews.Author: Miusa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a brief business trip. The hotel was terrific, everything you'd expect from a Grand Hyatt Hotel. The rooms were perfect, the bed comfortable, service first class. The only downside is they charged a fee for interest access.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location -”
Reviews.Author: wwills
Reviews.Content: Not to be confused with the regular Dallas Airport Hyatt Regency. Great hotel located near the C/D gates. Spacious room, clean nice lobby, great meeting areas. Room has plenty of space for laptop, etc. Beds are large and comfortable. Large flat screen TV. Complimentary toothpaste. Very large bathroom with shower and bathtub. Mini-bar, safe. Only nitpick I have is that the rooms donâ€™t come with a coffee maker unless you ask for one. But overall a very nice, quiet experience.

Reviews.Title: “5/9/10 Stay Here When Your Miss Your Connection”
Reviews.Author: RoseAlee
Reviews.Content: After volcanic delays and a missed connection, we picked the DFW Grand Hyatt because of the location within the DFW airport. After 13 hours getting out of London we were tired and needed something soothing. The Hyatt fit the bill. My wife called the hotel directly on her cell phone and got a rate of $249/night. The checking took virtually no time and the staff were great. I guess they deal with a lot of "missed connection" traffic. The rooms are quite (no airplane noise) and spacious, including terry-cloth robes and even toothpaste. After checking in we went to the bar for a cocktail and were served by a most helpful waitresses. My wife had a tuscan bean soup with truffle oil and a salad - the presentation being unique and my wife said was "delicious". I had another drink!. If we miss another flight at the DFW airport, I can assure you we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Zacharius
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in this hotel and loved it. From the moment I arrived, I was greeted very warmly at the front desk by Jenna, shown the restaurant, bar, excellent fitness center and pool. Great views of the airport if you love airplanes like I do, with almost no aircraft noise. Rooms: great size, very comfortable, great views. Bathroom large, shower and bathtub excellent. Beds fairly comortable, TVs nice, channel selection acceptable. Bar/Restaurant: Quite expensive as you would expect, but the service is top notch and the food delicious. I had the asian seafood hot pot and it was fantastic, as was the bento box w/sushi, salmon, chicken and asian slaw. Burgers look tasty, as did quesadillas and desserts. Fitness Center/Pool: Fitness center had great equipment, all new and in good working order. Chilled towels were a nice touch! The pool, while somewhat small, is outdoors which is nice this time of year. Nice views of the airport from the pool and fitness center All in all, one of the better hotels I have stayed at, and probably the best airport hotel I have stayed at worldwide, and I make a habit of staying in a lot of airport hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt-One of Two Hyatts at DFW”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrierMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight upon return from Mexico (stayed at the Hyatt Regency on the way down). This hotel is the more upscale (and somewhat more expensive) Hyatt at DFW. It is connected directly to the Terminal D (the International Terminal). In fact, you can wheel your luggage or smarte carte right from customs over to the hotel elevator, ride up and check in! Another advantage of the location is that if you are on American Airlines, you can take the elevator back down, and check in (and check luggage) with American, even if you flight is leaving from a different terminal. (You can then go through security and take the SkyLink train to other terminals). The hotel is modern and fairly new. The rooms are large and very quiet for an airport hotel. The fitness center is bright and well equipped, and there is an outdoor rooftop pool (sunny, but you will also enjoy the smell of jet fuel). Overall, this is a fine hotel, especially for an airport hotel. It is particurly convenient if you are traveling internationally. On the other hand, the Hyatt Regency is also a convenient on-airport property and somewhat less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel, great attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: CanadaJoss
Reviews.Content: I flew into DFW late at night and stayed at the Grand Hyatt at the airport so I could pick up my rental car early the next morning. The service level was very good, the room was clean, modern and very quiet (I could not hear any planes). I worked out in the gym in the morning and the equipment is new and well kept. The outdoor pool was heated and I had a great swim in the cold weather. Breakfast the next morning was very good, much better than your average hotel food. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel gets it right!”
Reviews.Author: cmcfong
Reviews.Content: Ten of my girlfriends and I decided to meet in Dallas for a weekend. Although three of our group live in the area, we decided staying at a hotel would be the easiest arrangement. We chose the Grand Hyatt at DFW because it was convenient (we were arriving and departing on different flights). and the very good senior rate...some advantages to being old girls. It was the perfect choice. The hotel is conveniently accessible from all terminals. It is quiet (we could not hear the planes for the most part), very professionally staffed, clean, and beautiful. Our rooms were very nice and the bathrooms were fantastic. We had to request coffee machines for the room (Patty in Guest Services was always ready to help so that was no hassle) but otherwise everything we needed was in the rooms including yoga mats! The only disappointment was having to pay for the internet. I work on line and it is necessary for me to have access. $9.95 a day didn't break the bank but it annoys me at a business hotel. In the lobby of the hotel there was a chocolatier (wow!), a pastry and sandwich takeout, and a coffee bar. The bar and lounge area are comfortable and have wireless access (for a fee). The hotel restaurant, the Grand Met, is outstanding. We had breakfast and lunch there twice. The food is excellent, the wild salmon salad nicoise is great. The servers are professional and accomodating (no one balked at separate checks or slow eaters or late arrivals or people who sat chattering away for three hours). And they accomodated our whim to have the excellent gelato for our last breakfast. The restaurant was a tremendous plus and a great surprise. We wished we had had time to check out the spa since everything at the hotel was so nice, but we were there to be together. Maybe next time....................

Reviews.Title: “Make quick meetings enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: 20186traveler
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt is absolutely perfect for meeting planners and business people hoping to bring people in, meet for a few days, and head back out. The convenience is unmatched. What really sets it apart, though, is that as soon as you head up the escalator from the terminal you forget you are in the airport. It is quiet, upscale, and comfortable. For a small meeting, I highly recommend the conference suites. The food is good, the decor is modern and tasteful, and the staff is incredible.

Reviews.Title: “If you have a layover at DFW, then this is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: islandexplorer
Reviews.Content: Coming in on an international flight and don't even have to go outside. Walk from the terminal into the hotel....PERFECT. Print your boarding pass at the reception desk for your morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate, Comfortable Room & Central Location!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiians3
Reviews.Content: I have business meetings in Grapevine Texas so I went on Priceline to bid on a hotel room. I selected a four star hotel in the DFW area and ended up getting the Grand Hyatt DFW for just $56.00 per night! I was a bit concerned at first because I really didn't want to stay AT THE DFW AIRPORT, I was hoping to be close to the airport. I was pleasantly surprised how convienently located this hotel is to the American Airlines terminal. You literally pull your bag off the carusel and take an escolator up to the lobby. My double queen bedded room is clean, smells fresh and feels like it was renovated in the last couple of years. Comforatble beds, spacious bathroom, 36 inch LCD TV and a large desk to work at. T-Mobile broadband internet service is $9.95 for 24 hours. Parking is free for guests of the hotel in the DFW garage.

Reviews.Title: “Airport stop over”
Reviews.Author: KLHUsa
Reviews.Content: We pre-booked this hotel on the internet, whch saved us about $40, which really made our stay a good deal. The hotel was easy to get to and very well maintained. The room is bright, modern and clean. The gym was empty but fabulous - great gear and nice locker rooms. Even in a winter blizzard, the out door pool was still heated to 84F which was fun! We ate in the hotel restaurant. Portions were generous but flavorful and well presented. Our room faced the parking area but we did not hear any airplane noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best Airport Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: LiamBuckley
Reviews.Content: After spending 2 weeks in Belize with 3 kids we were returning to the USA and booked 2 rooms at the GH as we had an overnight stop at DFW. Although I usually stay with Hilton properties the location of this hotel for a morning flight was just too good to pass up. Room rate of $150 with 2 queens in each room and adjoing was perfect for us. Rooms are very well appointed with large bathromms, tub and seperate walk in shower - awesome water flow and pressure in the shower - lots of nice touches, mini bar and quality TV. Even though we looked over the airport we were not disturbed by noise at all. We were hungry as we had missed lunch and ate in the restaurant - excellent food including Calves Cheeks and awesome scallops. Imaginatively cooked and well presented on hot plates (hooray). Service was friendly (but not over friendly) and knowledgeable of the menu and wine list. First time I have ever had a discussion regarding Tempranillo grapes & Spanish Wines with an airport hotel waiter - very very good all round - a bit pricey but good - you get what you pay for. Nice hot shower and early out for our flight - compliments to the management.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel Inside DFW Airport”
Reviews.Author: FlyNavyCincinnati
Reviews.Content: This is a first class facility located right inside the DFW airport terminal. I stayed here for two nights while attending a company leadership conference. Check in went very smoothly - I arrived at 11 AM and they were able to get me into my room early. The rooms were good sized, nicely furnished and spotless. The bed was comfortable and I couldn't hear my neighbors or jets at all. The room overlooked two of DFW's runways which was interesting. The gym is very nice for a hotel - swimming pool located on the roof. I ate one meal at the hotel restaurant which was good. Like most full service hotels, the food and amenities here are a little pricey. We held our meetings in the hotel conference rooms - good facilities which enabled us to get a lot of work done. Overall a great place which I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business meeting!”
Reviews.Author: Msullivan66
Reviews.Content: I flew into Dallas for a one-day meeting that was being held at the Grand Hyatt DFW. From check-in to check-out, the customer service was incredible. The hotel is clean and very well kept. The room was incredible and I was lucky enough to get a "run-way" view; the bathroom was HUGE!!! It was a great night sleep and a perfect experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Deal”
Reviews.Author: Evan H
Reviews.Content: Great level of service. Missed the free coffee time by 20 min but they would not let me pay for the coffee they brewed for me. Called a valet to come and get my car (had a high clearance problem with the garage) at 2am. Room was great with an amazing bathroom. Great location IF you are going to visit Dallas and Fort Worth--a little far from Downtown Dallas if that is the only place you are visiting. The Grand Hyatt is inside the international terminal at DFW Airport so super easy to catch an early flight. My only complaint was the difficulty in getting some good food after 10pm--a small problem.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: irinski
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located in the terminal of Dallas Fort Worth airport this hotel offers great value for the price. It is perfect if you have an early flight. It is very clean, and it is obvious it is either really new or recently renovated. The service is excellent (the concierge woke up the valet at 2 am for us). The only issue I have is with the after hours menu at the restaurant (I believe between 10 pm and midnight) - it is terrible! Somehow did not fit such a luxurious hotel. May as well get some fast food!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay... one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: dragonOL2
Reviews.Content: What a great experience... everything about this hotel was high class... the courteous staff, the awesome fitness room, the comfy settings, definitely a great place. Just like another reviewer, our room was facing the airport runway and we could barely if at all hear the planes taking off and arriving... it was kinda eerie because you expect all this noise but it's strangely calm... and just like another previous reviewer, I found myself hypnotized by the runway... you would think that it would get boring, but watching them take off and land over and over was amazing. Anyway, the restaurant at the hotel was awesome as well... we stayed about 5 days and had breakfast each day that we were there. The staff at the restaurant were AWESOME and really made you feel welcome and attended to. The food was great as well. I will definitely try to stay here again if I ever go back to Dallas (but only on the awesome deal we got on the room rates) and it's definitely recommended to anyone staying in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jack783
Reviews.Content: Spent one night there before an early flight the next morning. The convenience can't be beat especially if you are flying American Airlines. The front door to the hotel is actually part of the AA terminal building; go up the escalator to the lobby. When you go to your flight just go back down the escalator and the AA checkin counters and security are right there. If you have a car you can park in the terminal parking and the hotel receptionist will give you a coupon so you don't have to pay for parking (at DFW you get a ticket when you enter the airport grounds and pay on the way out). The hotel's common areas and rooms are topnotch. Modern, clean and new. The rooms are spacious and beds very comfortable. Windows are very soundproof so you can't hear the airplanes--it was nice to watch them take off and land, though. No coffee maker in the room, but there is a card that says they will bring you one. Internet is T-Mobile, $7.99 for 24 hrs. The health club is also modern and new--it has six treadmills (which is how I gauge the size of a health club) with built in TVs, weights, etc., all late model Lifefitness. The outdoor pool is somewhat small so hard to swim laps, but you may not want to swim outside in the jet fumes anyway. You pay a slight premium for the location, but it's definitely worth it. One of the best airport hotels I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt customer service was awesome”
Reviews.Author: 3B
Reviews.Content: Arrived at DFW after driving back from Amarillo we had decided to spend the night/day here rather than risk a 5.5 hour drive down on the day of departure (just in case). We took the bus from the car rental return back to the Hyatt in Terminal D. we were greeted by Crystal at check in and was blown away by her customer service the likes of which I have not experienced in years this level. As this is one of a series of trips we are taking this year to celebrate 30 years of marraige I had requested a room overlooking the runway, we were allocated a room that was on the 7th floor and overlooking the runway. The room was huge as was the bathroom which was very well appointed which all the amenities you needed. You have a bathrobe but strange that there was only 1 of them.... there is also a Yogamat, Minibar (electronic so don't touch if you don't want a charge), a docking port for IPOD's. The bed sure was comfy and gave me a good night sleep that was until someone very kindly (not) rang our phone @ 6.30am, not impressed. There is an ice machine on each floor at the south end of the corridor along with a vvending machine $2 per bottle. After freshening up we went for a drink in the bar and then onto a meal in the restaurant, the food was real nice, not a massive choice on the menu but the quality and presentation was very very good. The food is prepared in the open kitchen in the restaurant and you can see the care and attention the Chef's put into the creations they are making. I had a crab starter that was layered ontop of slices of rolled cucumber and sliced tomato, topped with the crab and dressing either side. For main we both had Steak which was good as well, although my husband's was not cooked as he wanted Medium / Well it was still a bit red inside, they offered to recook it for him which he declined as I would have finished mine by the time his came back and that would have spoilt the evening more. This was served with straw fries that had way too much salt on them (apparently Texan's like them like that) and a Port Jus. No pudding for me but an apple tart a la mode for my other half. We also had breakfast the next morning and that too was lovely, mine was a toasted Bagel with cream cheese, smoked Salmon and Capers, my husband had fried eggs, sausage, herb breadcrumbed filled tomato and asparagus. All very nice indeed. The customer service from all whom we spoke with / came into contact with was outstanding! Nothing and I mean nothing was too much trouble for anyone. This customer service was throughout the whole team and continued through to the end of our visit, even from the housekeeping lady who greeted us as we passed her in the corridor her manner would have made you think she was the Duty Manager. Unfortunately for us the weather was awful, rain, rain and more rain so we were not able to make use of the rooftop pool and as we had a package which included breakfast and late check out of 2pm we went to the room and relaxed till time to go to the terminal. If you are not flying till the following day you have the ability to go into departures area from the Hyatt, you ask the Concierge and they arrange for a uniformed officer to come escort you after they have completed a few details and called a colleague to run a check on you with details taken from your driving licence. They then escort you to the security screening area which is just at the bottom of the escalators, here they present the paperwork and us to the TSA officer who take us to one side for seperate screening, this does not take long just the normal standard screening you would go through along with a "pat down" once this is cmplete you are free to go anywhere in DFW terminals via the Skylink so you can go have a look around the other teminals and eat / drink /shop whilst you are there. All in all I was blown away by the team here, the only complaint really would be the lifts could do with being speedier when called.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UFTAMU
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and everything you would expect an upper class Hyatt Hotel to be. Our room faced the runway but could barely hear the planes taking off and landing. Fitness room was large and had all the equipment you would need. The roof-top pool was probably the only negative experience since you are exposed to the sounds and smells of the jet engines. Food in the restaurant was great - suggest eating at the bar for a more relaxed atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Flight cancelled by American but well treated by Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: lovetraveltips
Reviews.Content: Ended up at the Grand Hyatt DFW after our flight was cancelled due to "weather" and American could not get us on any other outbound flights home. With a 12 hour wait until our next flight and kids in-tow we opted to stay at the Grand Hyatt as it was attached to the airport. Our check-in was swift, tootbrushes and toothpaste provided (as we couldn't get our bags). The next morning we were checked in to our flight without having to go to the airport terminal by the most pleasant gentleman at the front desk. I wish I could remember his name (we were there 07/27/09 AM) so I hope if the manager is reading this you can give him kudos! Thanks Hyatt for customer service as it was lacking the night before from American Airlines.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel, right at the airport, so convenient!”
Reviews.Author: travolor
Reviews.Content: When thunderstorms delayed my flight from DFW to Boston, I decided to spend the night in Dallas and finish the trip early the next morning, rather than try to make an iffy delayed afternoon flight. The Hyatt was right at the airport, had very comfortable, spacious, modern rooms, and tasty food in its restaurant. The next morning, I checked out and was right at the airport--no shuttle to synchronize with.

Reviews.Title: “Just average.......”
Reviews.Author: wintersummer
Reviews.Content: We just spent one night at the DFW Hyatt. Honestly, it's just like any other hotel. We were so hopeful for it to be extra special, based on fact it's a "grand" Hyatt - and from all the positive reviews. Front desk always seemed overwhelmed, serving as the switchboard and reception desk. Room was very nice, comfortable, and had almost everything we needed. Rooms do not have coffee pots. However, a call to room service and coffee pot was delivered. Dinner at the restaurant was less-than-optimal. Service was alright, but it took about 40 minutes for sandwich order. It's an open kitchen, and there was absolutely no hussle at all - kitchen staff were the slowest I've ever seen! Food was just average. Breakfast service was much more prompt, with food being much better. You can't beat the location. Noise level was not bad at all. It was actually a delight sitting in the room, overlooking runways and watching take-offs and landings.

Reviews.Title: “You can depend on this one”
Reviews.Author: longtimeresident
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend conference at the other airport Hyatt and took the shuttle back and forth. I am glad i did. As a very frequent traveler I can say this is an excellent hotel. Very clean, well-designed, comfortable rooms, quiet (very important at an airport hotel), professional and courteous staff, good food, excellent fitness center/pool area on top floor. As a Hyatt Platinum Passport member, I was upgraded to a larger room and was very pleased with the stay. If you have to stay at DFW, I recommend the Grand Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: ashc6804
Reviews.Content: We were between flights for the night and stayed with our 14 month old at the Grand Hyatt DFW. It was so nice, new, clean, and the staff was outstanding! It was late so we ordered room service for dinner, it was so good and well prepared that we ordered again for breakfast. They brought a crib with clean linens for the baby, staff member put it together and included a freshly washed teddy bear, blanket and toiletries for the baby. In the morning the bell man took us and our luggage to the airline checkin. I would most certainly recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: dkseattle
Reviews.Content: I went to Dallas for a business trip and for convenience I decided to stay at an airport hotel - which, not surprisingly, I dont associate with quality. Boy was I wrong here. The hotel is new, stylish, comfortable, just a great overall package. the rooms are modern and fresh, but not cold. I only stayed one night so I can't comment much on the service other than the valets being great. And the gym was first class, although a bit crowded. Of course the location was as advertized - right at the airport, no shuttle, no issue. Just great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and for Business, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Naim00
Reviews.Content: The only negative is that the high speed internet is paying. By the way if you bill it through the room you pay 9.99/day if you pay it through your CC on TMobile airport it's 6.99.. saves you 3$!!! The location for a quick business meeting is ideal. DFW is probably one of the nicest airports in the US and getting around it is so pleasant and convenient. The hotel is conveniently located just outside of security.. No matter what Gate you arrive at you will get to the hotel in 5-10 minutes. Rooms are exceptionally clean and spacious. Flat screen TV, great linen and nice toiletry. The bar and the restaurant are decent as well and the food (though served at midnight) was excellent. Service is very very friendly and professional. My room was on the 1st floor and unfortunately there was no view, but at the end of the day you are still at the airport..

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Consultant2468
Reviews.Content: What a contrast to the very poor downtown Dallas Hyatt. This Hyatt stays very busy because of its location but still manages to keep its property fresh, clean, well-maintained, and staffed with good service. Excellent food in the restaurant, superb room service, excellent and friendly staff, great location.

Reviews.Title: “grand hyatt made me feel better after a cancelled flight”
Reviews.Author: NCreviewer
Reviews.Content: After a delayed flight, I missed my connection in Dallas and was upset to learn I would have to wait almost 24 hours for a connection. I went to Terminal D because I remembered seeing signs for the Grand Hyatt there. It is so convenient - just a couple hundred feet outside of security. I had no problem checking in, and had a lovely room. I ordered room service and they let me order things that were on the online restaurant menus but not on the room service menu. The food was good not amazing, but miles above anything you'd normally find in an airport. The internet connection was good. You can hear planes taking off but it was quieter than I expected. Overall, this experience makes me feel better about connecting through Dallas in the future - it is good to know there is such a pleasant place to wait for one's flight. Oh, and they offered me an emergency toiletries kit upon learning that my bag went on without me. It is true that the minibar charges you when an item is displaced, but that was clearly labeled and actually I found it to be a good thing, as it meant all charges were on my bill when I left (as opposed to waiting for an updated bill).

Reviews.Title: “Plush Experience”
Reviews.Author: Breber17
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Grand Hyatt DFW as I was there on business. Overall, great experience. Hotel is quite lovely, and the staff were all quite friendly and willing to go out of their way to assist you. It's proximity to the airport was appealing. No need to rent a car, just walk on over to the hotel. Easy access for departure the next day. The rooms were a nice size with a comfortable bed and a large bathroom where you had a choice of the shower stall or tub. Surprisingly, vey little noise from the airport. We hosted a cocktail party for customers, and everything went off without a hitch. Food and drinks were all excellent and well presented. We paid $195.00 as a group rate, and I do think they could have thrown in wireless for free. Prices are expensive but no different than staying at any high-end hotel. The hotel does offer a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular DFW Upscale Experience!”
Reviews.Author: mike257
Reviews.Content: I booked through hotwire and picked up this hotel for one night from December 31st-January 1st 2009. I arrived at Terminal B and hopped on the shuttle bus, driver dropped me right at the door for the Hyatt. This hotel is gorgeous inside and out. Upon getting upstairs I was greeted by a very friendly checkin lady. After telling her I was coming from South Florida, going to Denver the next day and onto Canada the following day, she offered me a free meal in the restaurant! Very nice surprise and great! I headed up to the room. I had a cool view of the airport runways which shockingly wasnt noisy despite the planes taking off. The bathroom was gorgeous, black marble with a separate tub and walk in shower, huge vanity. The bed was what you'd expect of a high end hotel, top quality and very soft. Headed back downstairs, front desk helped me with directions and recommendations to downtown Dallas, and how to get my rental car. Overall, a fantastic experience! Top notch hotel, only drawback is the 9.99 a day WiFi, but I figured for paying 59 for this hotel on hotwire which is an absolute steal, I could handle it! Highly recommend staying here if you have a layover at DFW.

Reviews.Title: “The best stop-over hotel in DFW!”
Reviews.Author: Linescrew
Reviews.Content: EXTREMELY great location of an upscale hotel, attached to the Dallas/Fort Worth Airport. I used this hotel for a layover flight from Miami to Vancouver and booked with a priceline bid of only $69 plus taxes (regular rates are $140 and even higher at times). Rooms are very spacious, have a nice desk for business (Wi-fi is not free-a negative), bathrooms have seperate shower and bathtub. I was concerned about the airport noise, but it wasn't that bad. You can hear some of the closer planes taking off, but they have done as best of a job as they could to insulate for this. Food cost are very high and so is the mini-bar....touch at your own peril! Great well equipped hotel with pool and fitness center. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: Reefwatcher
Reviews.Content: I decided to "splurge" on the Hyatt for my Dallas layover, rather than choosing an off-airport hotel -- and I couldn't have been happier with my decision. This is a beautiful hotel with first-rate service. My corner room was big enough to play tag football, and it was perfectly appointed. The decor, the technology, the gorgeous marble bath with separate tub and shower, and the luxuriously comfortable bed -- it was all simply perfect. I had a wonderful late dinner at the restaurant, with fabulous food and spot-on service. I opted for a room service breakfast, which was as easy as hanging out a door tag by 2:00am. My breakfast was hot when it arrived, exactly what I wanted, and delivered on time with gracious and efficient service. The convenience of grabbing your suitcase off the carousel and just heading up the escalator to the hotel lobby is undeniable - but the proximity is even more appreciated for a morning departure. I got a good rate through Hyatt's website, with a "pay in advance" discount. For the caliber of this hotel, it was a bargain. I'll welcome the chance to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great to depart the plane and walk right into your room!”
Reviews.Author: Prospect_Park_Johnny
Reviews.Content: Had to visit Dallas on business and picked this hotel due to my loyalty to hyatt brand and reviews on this website. Experience lived up to expectations and far exceeded my experience the next night when i stayed at the Joule (starwood boutique) in downtown dallas. Check-in literally took 1 minute and room service was excellent. The best part was stepping out of the plane and being in my room's shower within about 10 mins. Tough to beat if you are in dallas on business. John NYC

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: IdahoCoug
Reviews.Content: This is amazing, we overnighted here both ways on a vacation to Central America, the convenience is great, we arrived at Terminal E and the Terminal Link driver dropped us right at the elevators for the hotel, check in was quick and professional. They had an airport police officer come up and check our ID's and fill out some forms so we could go through security and eat in one of the restaurants in Terminal E. The exercise facility and pool have a wonderful view and the fully stocked lockerroom with steam room was also excellent. 10 minutes after we checked out we had checked our bags and cleared security for our flight. On our return trip, once we cleared customs and rechecked our bags, the escalator up from the customs level exits right where the escalator for the hotel is, so 5 minutes after clearing customs we were checked in and in our room! Room service was good as well, we preordered our breakfast the night before to be delivered at 5 AM, and we got it at 4:55! All airports should have a Grand Hyatt in the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant airport stay”
Reviews.Author: Blaize76
Reviews.Content: The hotel, restaurant and bar were modern yet comfortable. The beds were soft and each had a variety of pillows for varied firmness. The bathrooms had showers and soaking tubs. The biggest downfall was no ear plugs in the room. My second night I heard planes quite frequently and could have used something to block the sound. This was a great hotel for business travelers needing to access the outskirts of town. The biggest downfall is having to valet your car as the only other option is to park and take the shuttle in from short-term parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Location Higher End Hotel”
Reviews.Content: The location was absolutely perfect if you needed to be on the grounds of the terminals at the airport. It doesn't get any better than this. The staff was extremely professional. Ryan the gentleman that checked me in was extremely helpful. The room was very nice and clean. My only issue was that I am a light sleeper and the planes woke me up in the middle of the night and early morning. If you are a light sleeper I would recommend that you stay on the side that doesn't face the runway. I didn't admire the view of planes taking off and if I ever had to go there again I would take a room on the opposite side of the runway. The hotel definitely has a very upscale feel to it. There is a shuttle at the airport run by the Grand Hyatt thake will take you from your terminal to the Grand or the other Hyatt property at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not what you expect”
Reviews.Author: icaqt4me
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for the weekend through Hotwire and at the front desk they seemed to "have a problem" with my reservation not being in their system. I got the impression that they give certain "under quality" rooms for guests who book through Hotwire/Priceline and such. Although the room I was given was OK..it lacked a dresser for your clothes, a room safe, a minibar and was directly across from the elevator traffic. A coffee pot had to be requested and this one leaked water. Needless to say, I was disappointed as the hotel wasn't full by any means. I like to sometimes stay at hotels in the area where I live to see how your treated given the discount you get through Hotwire. Although the staff was friendly..it didn't make up for the "slight" of the room. All in all it was a nice hotel, though, but I would choose another hotel to stay at or recommend in the area instead of this one.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: Elektricblu
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the doorstep after a cancelled flight.... and they were fantastic!!!! Got me into a great room (up high, overlooking the runway, but it was so quiet you wouldn't know it!). I was lugging an 18month old and 2 bags with no help, and they were quick and kind, and even gave my baby a teddy to entertain him. Room service was great (only fault was that it isn't 24hours) so I had to go downstairs to the 24 hour lounge to get some warm milk at 2am for my baby). Unlike other hotels it was no problem for them to take bottles down to the kitchen and wash them properly. DId I mention they make a great hamburger and have a good kids menu too. As my luggage had been lost they gave me a free toiletries kit. In the morning I had to check out at aout 5:30am for an early flight! When I arrived downstairs they had already checked me in for the flight the night before, but when I arrived downstairs and checked out, they checked me out and advised that my flight was cancelled. They promptly checked me back in and helped me reschedule flights for later in the morning. Yes it is a little expensive, but when you are tired and want a high quality, comfortable hotel, that is part of the airport terminal. Grand Hyatt DFW is your place. Thanks for the great stay.

Reviews.Title: “DFW Hyatt was a great find”
Reviews.Author: JanetFincher
Reviews.Content: We were stranded at DFW with a cancelled flight ten o'clock at night with the airport closing and nowhere to go. Refusing to panic, I remembered being very favorably impressed with the airport Hyatt in San Francisco, so in spite of my airline's attempt to steer me to the Holiday Inn in North Dallas, I called the Hyatt at DFW anyway. I was happy I did. The hotel was beautiful, the room was great, and we enjoyed the bar after we checked in (we needed a good bar after the travel "adventure" we had just had) and we liked the Mexican breakfast in the hotel restaurant the next morning. All in all, the hotel salvaged a bad travel day and turned it around. We took off the next day for our final destination in a much better state of mind and wallet. They did undercharge for the room since we checked in late--gave us the Holiday Inn price for the Hyatt experience. So if I end up staying at an airport hotel again, I will definitely look for a Hyatt first, if they have one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, good conf facilities”
Reviews.Author: Badputtr
Reviews.Content: This is an on airport property. The only bad thing I could name was that I couldn't take the train to my desired terminal because I had checked luggage and wasn't on "american airlines.' As soon as I arrived via shuttle bus from my terminal, bell staff was there to take my bags. (golf bags get me automatic bell service, otherwise I haul them.) They were very responsive, timely, helpful, etc. The bell man even suggested restaurants (unsolicited) and other helpful info. My usual late arrival room service was very good, but pricey. The sunset over the runway/traffic control terminals was very cool. The full moon was equally good. Who could have imagined a room with a view at the airport. (No noise either!) The room was very modern, very clean, and well apportioned. Maid service was good. When I needed to catch the shuttle to terminal e, the bellman/limo driver was extremely helpful. (A cabbie didn't know where one of the better known golf courses or hotels was located the day before.) I'd stay there again!.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: jwcarlstrom
