Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an early departure to California and decided to stay at the Grand Hyatt. I had purchased the Park, Sleep, Fly package and it was well worth the money. I was a little worried after arriving that the noise from the departing planes was going to be an issue. I'd have to say that this was the quietest place I think I've ever stayed in my life. The night that we arrived, there just happened to be a terrible thunder and lightening storm that was passing through and my wife and I slept without hearing single peep. The room is very modern with all the up to date electronic devices and gadgets. The bathroom was absolutely amazing and roomy. There was a very large tub, a seperate walk in shower and hamper. The bed was very comfortable and was filled with pillows, I mean lots of comfortable pillows. If you don't want to pay the high costs of room service or pay the ridiculous price of a soda or water out of the fridge, I recommend going to the Grapevine Mills Mall which is close by and provides wonderful restuarants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravAmerIntl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel right inside the airport terminal. Our room had a fabulous view of the runway. There is a roof top pool. We stayed here our last night of our trip because we had an early departure the next morning. I wish we had more time to enjoy the hotel, it was really nice. Super convenient for early flights.

Reviews.Title: “Our Lifesaver”
Reviews.Author: SandieSometimes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our lifesaver as American Airlines in it's infinite wisdom, screwed up on our connector flight home (after having screwed up on our connector flight to Cancun from LA). And to top it all off, all of the hotels that they had available for mechanical issues such as these were all booked due to severe weather issues they were also having at the same time. So we had NO CHOICE but to rent a room on our own. My husband and I had been attempting to get home from Cancun and I had a case of Montezuma's Revenge. I had just about had it with traveling for that week. If not for this Hyatt, I may have lost my sanity! They took us immediately, gave us a spectacular rate, and even went so far as to upgrade our room because the gentleman at the check-in counter could see in my eyes how miserable I was feeling. (Very, very nice British gentleman, didn't catch his name, but he went above and beyond!) We were able to get a full and peaceful night's rest and the room itself was BEAUTIFUL. Modern, clean and very well maintained. I was absolutely in love with the room! If I ever get stuck in Dallas again, I wouldn't hesitate one minute to stay here. It was refreshingly wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “What an airport hotel should be!”
Reviews.Author: ChaunceyGardiner
Reviews.Content: WOW- Iâ€™m really, really impressed. The hotel lobby is an escalator ride up from the TSA level of this terminal. Very clean, very much new Hyatt style. Iâ€™m Plat with Hyatt, and successfully obtained a runway view room. Hyatt Grand bed, big flat screen tv, and a separate shower and tub- the first time Iâ€™ve seen this in a US hotel, although pretty standard in Asia. Room was excellent overall, and didnâ€™t show the wear and tear I usually expect at an airport property. This hotel had been named as one of the five top airport hotels in the world by the Financial Times, so I was pretty jazzed about seeing it. In brief, it does make the cut. The FT called out both the iPod wine tasting and the tablet menus in the restaurantâ€¦ so off I went. I ordered the white wine tasting, and they brought over four tastings of white wine, and an iPod (yes, I brought my own earbuds). The wine video, though, was disappointing. It was cursory at best, and the guy in the video could have done so much more with this medium. Cool, but would not repeat. I had dinner in the restaurant which had two neat gadgets. First, the menu was done on a tablet pc, mounted to a standup bracket, which was brought over. However, it didnâ€™t have pricesâ€¦ so they handed me the standard printed menuâ€¦ kind of defeats the purpose of the jazzy tech, huh? Also, there were typos in the menu and the tablet. What was cool, though, was the individual flat screen tvs for solo travelers. Nice touch, although the seating area was kind of dark, and a I had to fumble for the channel switches on the tv set. Also, I checked in the gift/deli area for postcards to send to Dad and Kiddoâ€¦ none there, but the lady at the counter gave me two postcards of the Hyatt, WITH postage already on themâ€¦ very nice touch. Access heads-up: The entrance to the airport, which includes the high-speed shuttle train, only works if you are flying with AA, or if you have carry-ons only. I was on NWA, and had a suitcase, so couldnâ€™t get through security. Hyatt drove me to my terminal in a van, but that was a bit annoying. Not Hyattâ€™s fault, just bear in mindâ€¦ Terrific stay, and sets a new standard for airport hotels in the US. I will happily return next time I need an overnight transit at DFW.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible convenience”
Reviews.Author: njpmg
Reviews.Content: Due to an early morning flight, I opted for this hotel for the sheer convenience, and it was terrific! After using the check-out kiosk, I took the elevator directly down to the terminal and security checkpoint. Despite the pricey cost of the room, I felt it was well worth it because of the location of the property. I was upgraded to a huge suite at no extra cost. The staff proved to be extremely helpful and went out of their way to make my stay comfortable. The gym on the 9th floor was great! I had 2 issues though: 1) the bed was a little lumpy maybe because it was a Murphy bed? Don't know why I had a Murphy bed in that huge suite, and 2) the bathroom had a weird odor -- could have been the cleaner b/c it was otherwise very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business meetings”
Reviews.Author: MinnTex
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business. The room was very quiet; you couldn't hear most of the air traffic, which was quite surprising. The bed was comfy with lots of great pillows. The bathroom was really huge. The food was excellent (though pricey). The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, both personally and in support of our meetings. My only complaint is that internet access cost another $10/day through T-Mobile; for as much as the room costs, I think the internet should be free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: farmeronthego
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the greatest beds. They are comfortable and the rooms are quiet. You pay for the location though. We will stay here again if we have to. We love connecting through DFW as this is the easiest airport in the world to get around because of the skylink. This property is tops in my view.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but airport location can be an issue”
Reviews.Author: BillPinNJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt DFW over the Jan 11 - Jan 14 weekend while in town for the Cowboys / Giants playoff game. It was our first visit to Dallas and we chose the airport location to make the arrival and departure legs of the trip easier. DFW is a massive airport and requires some time to get acclimated as the ground transportation system - along with the airport car rental / parking / airport roadways - is quite extensive and can be confusing. The hotel is nice with big, clean rooms and large bathrooms. The view of the runway is cool. We were on the 6th floor and noise was not an issue. We found that food options were limited though. The hotel restaurant is very expensive. You are permitted to access the restaurants located within Terminal D but getting the security clearance card from the hotel (I think done by Dallas PD) and then working through the airport security lines can be very time consuming. And it causes a bit of a stir at airport security when you are without a boarding pass. We went through some extra scrutiny. As to location - we concluded that it would have been better for us to have stayed in downtown Dallas. The drive from the airport to anywhere is long and given that we were only there for the weekend we would have preferred a Downtown location nearer to Dealey Plaza and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: parcvue
Reviews.Content: I never stay at airport hotels but I will certainly stay at the Hyatt again. This new property is top notch. Great rooms with flat screens and even better bath rooms. Nice bar area, ok-ish restaurant and a great health club...there is even a roof top pool to catch some Texas rays.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: lizicat
Reviews.Content: This is a luxury hotel in the Dallas Fort Worth Airport Terminal D. I stayed here, as it is ranked the #1 hotel in Dallas, but I did not have a flight. It is not too far from the tourist stops if you are staying here for the weekend. I drive between Texas and Oklahoma and am seeking a mid-way point. I think I've found it. The staff working at this hotel are outstanding. The concierge were very attentive and took care of issues quickly. It was my birthday, and a wonderful concierge sent me a small snack of chocolate covered strawberries. It was so lovely to receive, as I was working on my birthday and was without family. The room is large and clean with a great view of the airport landing strips. The bed had 9 pillows. The bathroom has a separate shower and bath. All amenities are included-- slippers, bathrobe, full-size soaps, nice-smelling shampoo, Starbucks coffee, large TV, etc. I have T-mobile for internet, and the hotel did not charge extra. The pool is fantastic and you have a real treat watching the planes take off and land. The gym has several treadmills and high quality gym equipment. You have a view of the airport as you jog. The spa can get busy, and I could not get an appointment on Saturday short notice. Although you are at the airport, it seems the hotel has made an effort to minimize the noise. If you are very sensitive, you should bring earplugs. I had no problems, but some large 747s can come in at all hours. Terminal D was not very busy, and the concierge can provide you with a pass to pick up dinner, etc. I think the regular price for this hotel is typically <$200 if you book far enough in advance or have a corporate rate. The value and service for the price I paid is excellent. A lot of reviews have probably been written for this hotel, as it is in the airport. There is a reason why this place is #1 in Dallasâ€” I would say service, cleanliness, location, and attention to detail are the top points.

Reviews.Title: “very upscale, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: okmitzi
Reviews.Content: it's hard to find any negatives about this hotel. very upscale, located IN the airport. i paid $129 which included breakfast for two, which was awesome. free parking, plus was given a few other coupons (coffee bar, etc) when i checked in. great first run "on demand" movie selection. i'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What More Could You Ask For”
Reviews.Author: Layover
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler through Dallas to other destinations, I've experienced the usual-come-with-the-gig travel snafus. This is now my defacto first call. Even if my luggage made it to the last flight to Vancouver, I know that I can get a ditty bag of essentials (better then any at any other hotel I know of) and can be in the hotel and in my room in 15 minutes. It doesn't get better then that. I *am* disappointed that they've made restaurant adjustments. The sushi bar was outstanding. The food is still outstanding, but I miss the sushi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at a Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: musicalmember
Reviews.Content: Great staff, clean rooms, comfy beds, large bath, separate tub and shower, quality linens, flat screen t.v., robes and yoga mat provided . . . . just to mention a few. This grand hotel is situated in the middle of the DFW Airport and we never heard an airplane in our room! Skylink or shuttle service is available to or from anywhere in the airport. The summer getaway rate included a great Sunday morning breakfast at the hotel restaurant. No routine hotel breakfast here. Order from the breakfast menu. Very attentive service. A coffee and drinks bar is open 24/7. The elevator to rooms is accessed by keycard holding guests only for added security. Be sure to take in the view from the rooftop even if you don't go up there to use the swimming pool or exercise room. It can be fun just to watch the action around the airport! We used the Hyatt after flying to Dallas to begin our vacation through Texas. The Grand Hyatt DFW is a hotel that would please no matter what brings you to the Dallas-Fort Worth area.

Reviews.Title: “Yeah, It's THAT good...”
Reviews.Author: TSestok
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt DFW with my husband from July 3 till July 7 while we were in town visiting family who lives in Keller, TX. At first I wasn't sure the hotel would be right for the trip I was planning because most of the reviews I read didn't mention anything to do with traveling in and out of the airport during stays. I am so glad we stayed at this hotel because everything good everyone said about it, is definitely true. The bed in the room was one of the most comfy beds I've ever slept in. The gym and pool on the roof were amazing. The flat TV and the iHome were great modern touches. And, for parking, you get a voucher each day to get out of the airport tollgate, it was pretty easy. What a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service but mattresses need changing”
Reviews.Author: Traveleasy
Reviews.Content: Checked in on July 11th for a night after fights to La Guardia were cancelled. Very smooth check-in, great looking hotel with well laid out rooms except the mattress in room 228 sagged to the point of giving the sensation of being pitched downwards. Mentioned it to the front desk on check-out to but the woman merely giggled! All else was very good - excellent room service, convenience to the terminal building including one-time access for emergency shopping for stranded passengers.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Courtesy_Flush
Reviews.Content: I only had a one night stay at this property, but I got a great impression of it during that time. It is easy to get there from any terminal via Skylink. I liked the location in terminal D because it was easy to browse around the shops while on breaks at my meeting. The room was nice, modern, and had a huge bathroom. Unlike the Hyatt I stayed at in San Diego, the tolietries actually smelled nice. The bed was gigantic and comfy. The staff was friendly and accomodating. The pool is tiny but the rooftop location is a great place to watch planes. My only complaint is that room service doesn't last long enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: MattEcho
Reviews.Content: I stayed here regularly for work for about 2 months this year. This is one of the nicest hotels in the Dallas/Ft. Worth area. It's really one of the nicest hotels anywhere and "the best" airport hotel. The rooms are very nice and clean. The amenities are great. The service is first class. The in-room dining is excellent. And the rooms must be well insulated, because I did not ever notice any jet engine noise. The only downside (or upside depending on how you look at it) is: This isn't a trendy hotel, like some in Dallas. So if you want nightlife, you need to drive to it.

Reviews.Title: “great staY”
Reviews.Author: kliz15
Reviews.Content: Stayed at grand hyatt may 11-13. Chose hotel based on reviews and it lived up to the hype. The hotel was modern, clean, and the service was excellent. Had a corner room on the seventh floor. The bed was comfortable, flat screen lcd tv was just like mine at home and the bathroom was good size for a standard hotel room. The location was extremely convenient for our 11 o'clock in the morning flight home. Travelled all around texas and the location at the airport didnt bother me at all. The staff was courteous and the valet for 25 dollars a day was worth it. Great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Travelers”
Reviews.Author: ANGshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for those who are travelling in and out of DFW, I could not imagine staying here otherwise. I would not consider this a luxury hotel; it is a lovely respite from the burdens of travel. The hotel and rooms are attractive, modern, clean and quiet. The bed and linens are comfortable, towels fairly thick. The shower head is oddly pointed at the door, so please do not make the mistake of turning on the water without either moving the shower head or getting in first. Also, the size of the shower makes shaving an acrobatic act. The pictures on the website and tripadvisor are accurate and speak fairly for themselves. The staff can be cool. Floor 4 is 1/2 smoking and 1/2 non-smoking, therefore, I recommend non-smokers avoid. Also, watch the rates on the Hyatt website; the rates can fluctuate quite a bit and if you secure a lower rate be sure to request an email confirmation as the hotel does not appear to get the revised rate. Upon each visit I had to show my blackberry to convince the hotel staff that I did indeed negotiate a lower rate. More work for the travel weary. Again, a lovely hotel if you find yourself at DFW.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAKTEX
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt is very nice - I like airport hotels and this rates one of the best. It is sort of intimate, not as big as you would think in terms of space in the public areas. Staff are very pleasant and go that little further than most. Hotel room was excellent, I love a separate shower and the space is good in both bathroom and room. Beds are very good - almost as comfortable as home. The work station is great - in fact I am typing this loking out from my desk at the Grand Hyatt room and watching American Airlines flight take off. Floor 9 leisue centre also very acceptable. The outside pool was perfect temperature despite the ambient being only a few degrees above freezing. The steam room was excellent and easy to control. Everything is available for you - you only need to ask. Would certainly stay here again.
